description_entreprise: Founded in 2016, OCUS produces high-quality, custom visual content at scale for international brands. To do so, they rely on a global community of over 20,000 highly-qualified photographers and image creators. Product-driven, they use state of the art tech to make the whole process seamless both for brands and image creators.  Today, they deliver 4000 photoshootings each week in 120+ countries, for customers such as UberEats, Grubhub, Radisson, Booking.com. By investing constantly in R&D and new technologies, they make intelligent content that reaches the right audience at the right time. They have closed a 20M‚Ç¨/$24M investment in March 2021 to further invest in product development and engineering while expanding its market presence worldwide. Four years ago, they were three people sitting at one desk. Today, the team is made of 100 passionate people from 20 nationalities, working from Paris, New York, Singapore.

description: Our story so far... Pigment‚Äôs mission is to enable people and businesses to make better decisions. Founded in 2019 by Romain Niccoli (ex founder and CTO of Criteo) and El√©onore Crespo (Index Ventures and Google), Pigment is a fast-growing international scale-up that raised $240M+ to become the central business planning solution powering Finance, HR, Sales, and Marketing decisions. We serve fast-growing companies including Gong, Carta, Ledger, Deliveroo, Brex, Melio, and Spendesk to name a few! We have offices in Paris, London, New York and Toronto. What we do Pigment is a SaaS planning platform that enables any business to play with business data in a safe, fun and collaborative environment. It is an intuitive platform, which anyone can use and understand, that allows leaders and teams to analyze all of their business data better and anticipate the impact of their decisions with unprecedented speed and flexibility. Join a forward-thinking team (from Meta, Google, Criteo, Datadog and others) that likes to move fast, work smart and solve big challenges as a team on this exciting journey! Job Overview Pigment is at the forefront of business planning software. Our mission is to revolutionize how businesses plan, analyze, and predict their strategies. With AI we are pioneering a new pathway in user experience and business modeling. Join us in transforming the way businesses strategize and prepare for success by incorporating AI into Pigment! We are seeking a passionate, skilled, and seasoned AI engineer who possesses a strong focus on creating large-scale enterprise software. Leveraging the capabilities of Generative AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP), you will be responsible for designing and developing a seamless conversational user experience within Pigment. Your pivotal role will involve shaping the vision and strategy for Generative AI at Pigment to change the future of Business Planning! Responsibilities: - Continuously research recent advancements in NLP and large language models, applying novel techniques and methodologies to improve our models. - Research, fine-tune, and improve prompting of LLM models for Pigment's advanced use cases (Information Extraction, Information Retrieval, Text Generation tasks, etc.) - Implement and deploy models in production environments - Conduct experiments and benchmarking to assess the performance of various models and architectures - Play a role in shaping the vision and guiding the future direction of Generative AI alongside the Product Manager. Qualifications: - MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field - Minimum of 5 years of experience in NLP and machine learning - Strong understanding of NLP techniques, including text representation, feature engineering, model selection, tokenization and embeddings - Hands-on experience working with large language models like GPT, LLAMA, BERT, or Transformer-based architectures - Experience with autonomous agents is a plus - Solid understanding of GCP and related ML offerings - Strong programming skills in SQL, Python and relevant ML libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn) - Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently - Strong written and verbal communication skills Folks from underrepresented minorities: science shows that you are less likely to apply if you feel that you don‚Äôt have all the necessary prerequisites. If this description matches where you are now or what you'd like to grow into in your next position, we encourage you to apply. What you will get - Competitive salary (70k to 130k) - Equity - The best health insurance with Alan Blue entirely free for you and your family üíô - Trust and flexible working hours - Brand new offices in the heart of Paris (Bourse) - Remote-friendly environment Pigment is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity is a strength and fosters innovation. We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and  valued at the workplace.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability,  sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, social origin, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We may process your personal data in accordance with our  HR Data Protection Notice .

description: THIS ROLE COULD BE BASED IN MUNICH, MILAN, MADRID, PARIS, LONDON OR LUXEMBOURG Amazon opened on the World Wide Web in July 1995 and today offers Earth‚Äôs biggest selection. Amazon strives to be Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online. By giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform. Amazon is looking for an experienced and passionate Senior Business Intelligence Engineer ‚Äì data analyst to support the EU Negotiations Program in its mission to improve selection, better prices and more convienence for our customers across our European Consumer business. The role of the Senior BIE, EU Negotiations, will be to provide insights into how macroeconomic trends may influence our profitability, build reports based on the latest technology to help retail teams monitor progress and course-correct when they are missing their objectives and help in the automation of key phases of the process. You will use data to support your ideas, drive actionable outcomes, and provide unique ways to present data and information in an easy to consume format. This role will work in close collaboration with the project teams, business teams, finance teams as well as other data and tech teams, both in Europe and across the world.    This role will be part of the European Retail team. The Product Manager Vendor Services , EU AVS position could be based in any location in which Amazon Retail teams are present (Paris, London, Munich, Milan, Madrid, Luxembourg). The Senior BIE ‚Äì Data Analyst, EU AVS will be responsible for:   - Drive deep understanding of vendor segmentation, behavior as well as Amazon operational performance and streamlining services by identifying, developing, and executing analyses.   - Build recommendation and insights on how to improve performance, economics and efficiency.   - Champion data and metrics instrumentation during the development lifecycle for new initiatives   - Drive development of tools, reporting improvements, and automation, and create new innovative and insightful reports.  - Support the business team with requests and analytical needs. - Support the development of our technical infrastructure (cluster, pipelines and metrics creation)   We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Clichy, FRA

intitule: Machine Learning Research Engineer - remote friendly
description: About the Project: Join our team as a Machine Learning Research Engineer and play a key role in the development and maintenance of our AI-based systems. From conceptualizing experiments to implementing innovative ideas, you will be responsible for all an AI/ML project‚Äôs life cycle. You will have the opportunity to impact the industry in a meaningful way, by participating in its transformation with AI. More concretely, our projects predominantly focus on text and speech data, emphasizing Natural Language Processing (NLP) and speech processing, including ASR, speech analysis, and denoising systems. As an ML Research Engineer, your responsibilities encompass a broad spectrum of tasks: - Conceiving and developing end-to-end AI systems, from data collection and processing to module development, and evaluation methods and metrics. - Defining and implementing AI systems, creating data pipelines, and incorporating features based on infrastructure and performance requirements. - Establishing a benchmarking system to compare and select system evolutions using tools like Hydra, Metaflow/MLFlow, Weight&Biases, etc. - Defining data collection, annotation, and processing protocols, developing processing pipelines, and creating datasets for specific applications. - Managing data collection and processing for training and testing machine learning-based systems. - Analyzing data to optimize products, adapting models, reconsidering modalities, and creating new user behavior metrics. (Optional)  Contributing to publications such as blogs, scientific articles, and interviews. What You Will Use: - Python - Machine learning libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX and huggingface's transformers library - Database technologies like MongoDB and SQL - MLOps platforms - Dependency management tools like Docker - Version control tools: git/github We Are Looking for Someone With: Required Skills: - Excellent proficiency in Python coding. - Proven experience in implementing machine learning systems. - Capability to work with popular machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX, huggingface's transformers library, and MLOps platforms. Proficiency with both TensorFlow and PyTorch is preferred. Preferred Skills: - Background in NLP or speech processing (ideally both). - Strong theoretical foundation. - Experience with NLP libraries and generative models. - Familiarity with ASR, speaker recognition, speech synthesis, and speaker diarization. - Proficiency in Docker for efficient deployment. - Knowledge of MLOps methodology and implementation. - Familiarity with database technologies (SQL or NoSQL) for effective data management. Recruitment process - Technical assignment - Call with a Talent Acquisition Manager - Technical interview with an engineer - Interview with a manager At Diabolocom, diversity and inclusion are in our DNA. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to color, language, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or social origin, opinion disability, age.

description: As a member of the AI team you will work in close collaboration with full-time data scientists, doctors, data engineers and product owners to improve the deep learning algorithms powering our products. These algorithms include, but are not limited to, region detection, keypoints detection, registration and classification on both 2D and 3D medical images. During the onboarding phase, you will familiarize yourself with our current solutions and learn the medical context in which you‚Äôll have the opportunity to make an impact. In particular, you‚Äôll learn about the pathologies we target, their patterns and the challenges that come with finding them. Then, iteratively and with the continuous support of one of our AI engineer you will have your shot at improving our models. Several directions for improvement have already been selected and you‚Äôll be encouraged to try your own ideas as well. This means you‚Äôll learn from experts in the field of deep learning and work on state-of-the art algorithms. ü•á Responsabilities Iterative improvement of our deep learning algorithms Weekly scientific reporting with your tutor Contribution to our internal deep learning codebase

intitule: Machine Learning Engineer Internship - Music Recommendation m/f/d
description: We are a leading company in the music streaming industry, with one of the largest catalogues on the market (over 120 million HiFi music tracks) and more than 9 million worldwide subscribers. To help access this vast amount of tracks, recommender systems are a key asset to retain and attract users. Suggesting relevant personalized songs, artists, albums, or playlists helps users actively explore the vast and mostly unknown musical landscape. At Deezer, the recommendation team is in charge of building machine learning models and algorithms like the Flow to achieve such a goal. For this purpose, transformers have recently emerged as a competitive approach for sequence modeling and generation in various sequential recommendation problems. Transformers  were successfully trained and deployed to perform automatic playlist continuation and considered for other features. They revealed promising performances. However, they can also exhibit some drawbacks like popularity biases. Consequently, they can impair accuracy and fairness in the recommendation algorithms. The objective of this internship will be to investigate one of the critical aspects related to the training of Transformers for music recommendation at scale on Deezer:  negative sampling .  The way we perform negative sampling during training is crucial. It is known to significantly impact the final performance of the Transformer, as well as its tendency to recommend popular tracks.  The intern will be supervised by a Senior Data Scientist from the Recommendation team, and will also directly work with other engineers and research scientists from Deezer. They will provide scientific and technical guidance throughout the internship. For experiments, Deezer ensures access to internal data, cutting-edge technology, and appropriate calculus power. Several previous interns from our team have tested their algorithms in production, and/or have published results from their work as scientific articles.
secteur_activite: Media, Music, Digital
description_entreprise: LIVE THE MUSIC WITH US   From a pioneer tech start-up created in 2007, Deezer has become one of the first French unicorns and the second largest independent music streaming platform in the world. description: Giskard defends the vision of a  Responsible AI  that serves the economic performance of companies while respecting the rights of citizens. To embody this mission, Giskard enables AI professionals (Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers) to  evaluate & test the quality of ML models. We are building the first collaborative & open-source  Quality Assurance platform for all ML models . We already empower customers with two solutions: 1. The Giskard Python library helps Data Scientists detect hidden vulnerabilities in ML models .  It makes the AI development process more efficient, by automating the identification of risks of biases, performance issues and errors.To try it, see this  documentation .  2. The Giskard Hub helps ML Engineers debug & monitor models, share dashboards, and collaborate It makes the deployment of new ML models safer and more efficient, by providing ready-made monitoring dashboards, catalogs of re-usable testing components, and ML debugging interfaces. Install it following this  documentation . Track record We recently raised our  first round of 1.5 million euros,  led by Elaia, with participation from Bessemer Venture Partners and notable angel investors. To read more about this fundraising and how it will accelerate our growth, you can read  our announcement . We also received a  strategic investment from the European Commission  to build a SaaS platform to automate compliance with the upcoming EU AI regulation. You can  read more here . Last November, Giskard was featured in  TechCrunch! Your role As a  Growth Engineer , you will be in the driving seat to accelerate the growth of Giskard (according to AARRR metrics, in particular after the initial awareness phase). Your  missions  will be to: Lead the design and implementation of our data collection, enrichment and quality processes across marketing, sales & product touch points. Collaborate closely with the marketing, product and sales team to understand the challenges and design data-driven solutions to facilitate decision-making. Build and enhance our Data Analytics infrastructure (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Cloud, Mixpanel, Hubspot, Segment, Orbit...). Create marketing and product automations, improving operational efficiency. Analyze key metrics to identify trends and insights to better understand our marketing-sales funnel & product usage and maximize the ROI of our initiatives. Present complex findings in an understandable and actionable manner to non-technical team members. Explore and test innovative marketing technologies and methodologies, sharing findings with the team. Keep up-to-date with the latest trends in marketing automation and product operations to ensure our strategies are state of the art. Requirements Skills 3+ years of experience in a growth engineering role , preferably in a tech company. Marketing Engineering knowledge : Marketing Automation (Zapier, Make...), Analytics (Google Analytics, GTM, Mixpanel...), Business Strategy, Predictive Modelling, Data Visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau...) Strong coding skills  (Python, SQL, JavaScript, HTML/CSS...) Knowledge of Cloud Computing  (Google Cloud, AWS)  and Data warehouse services  (BigQuery, Redshift). Expert at analyzing, optimizing and reporting on our KPIs  against stated goals (marketing campaigns, product usage...). Knowledge of marketing platforms and APIs . Impeccable written and oral proficiency in English . Strong bonus for French speaker. Ability to learn & deliver fast,  with the desire to complete assignments autonomously About you Passionate  about going from 0 to 1, fast Driven  by outstanding customer journeys Hungry  to learn new skills every day Curious  about the tech industry and its role in our society Empathetic  team player Recruitment process You can get an offer in  4 weeks  üöÄ Fit interview:  15 minutes Technical exercise:  10 days to complete Technical interview:  45 minutes Reference calls:  2 persons Final interview:  45 minutes Benefits We value  diversity, equity, and inclusivity . Giskard is an  equal-opportunity employer . We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran, or disability status. We are  remote-flex . We value productivity and work/life balance. You can adopt a  hybrid work schedule  where you come to the office  1-3 days / week . You can also work from other regions/countries on an occasional basis - just let us know 4 weeks in advance. We offer a  remote office kit  to all full-time employees: a powerful MacBook computer, external monitor, keyboard, mouse, etc. We also offer the best health insurance plan in France,  Alan Blue . In terms of benefits, we also offer  Swile  meal cards and  Gymlib  membership for sport & well-being. All full-time employees are granted a  significant equity package.  We want to include everyone in the adventure and make it a collective win. Salary: between 50 000 ‚Ç¨ and 70 000 ‚Ç¨ / year (brut) + 0.1 - 0.2% of equity.
secteur_activite: Software, Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning
description_entreprise: Giskard defends the vision of a Responsible AI that serves the economic performance of companies while respecting the rights of citizens. To embody this mission, Giskard enables AI professionals (Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers) to evaluate & test the quality of ML models. Co-founded in 2021 by 2 ex-Dataiku engineers and 1 researcher in AI Ethics, we are leveraging our deep experience in AI to build the first collaborative & open-source Quality Assurance platform for  all  AI models. We call our platform the ‚ÄúThree-point Safety Belt‚Äù for AI models ‚õëÔ∏è Open-source ML Testing library to help Data Scientists detect vulnerabilities & biases in ML models, automatically. Collaborative AI Quality Hub to help ML Engineers test, debug & explain AI models visually LLMon to monitor Large Language Models (LLM) applications to detect hallucinations & issues in real time.

description: YourArt is on the lookout for a talented individual who embodies both a researcher‚Äôs mindset and robust engineering skills. Our use of AI is extensive and varied, including e-commerce recommendation systems, Art History Matching, Artwork classification, Visual Search engines, and many more aspects of our future product. This role is for those who are passionate about pushing the boundaries of machine learning in the art and technology space. Responsibilities: As a potential future leader of the Machine Learning team and one of the first technical hires, you will need to be highly innovative and meticulous in the diverse ML projects you will undertake. You should be comfortable working in both research and production environments. Your duties will include: Proposing and developing machine learning models for various projects, with an emphasis on future scalability (e.g., favoring lightweight and simple models). Implementing and testing these models, selecting appropriate metrics based on their business impact. Deploying these models to production and monitoring their performance. Collaborating closely with other Tech team members, particularly Backend Engineers, in an Agile environment. Communicating and synthesizing your work for other YourArt members.

Product Marketing Support : Support the marketing and product teams in crafting effective messages to market our product features when launching new product marketing initiatives. description: At Captain Data, most of our work is ‚Äúhidden‚Äù - working on 100+ automation and 30+ data sources, it basically means there are 100+ products inside Captain Data. You can imagine that the number of services and features required to run such an engine is quite advanced. We have three APIs: an automation API, our ‚Äúframework‚Äù, that runs our 100+ automation on 3 different stacks between Kubernetes, micro-services etc. an Oauth2 API to handle Oauth2 dance + working as a proxy for 3rd party integrations our main back-end to schedule runs, handle data manipulation etc. Your main job will be focused on the first API, our automation framework. Please note that this job is requiring advanced knowledge, do not apply if you‚Äôve never worked on the following topics. This job has been tailored for you if‚Ä¶ ü¶Ñ you‚Äôre completely proficient with TypeScript & NodeJS (10+ & all its modules) you speak natively HTTP üôÇ you know your way with data manipulation, JSON, databases in general (Postgres, Mongo‚Ä¶) you‚Äôre perfectly comfortable with code architecture, design patterns, etc. you know how to reverse engineer APIs & have a lot of XP integrating & designing them you have the mindset of a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù, you like to build & iterate fast

description_entreprise: Captain Data is a no-code data automation platform designed for operations teams: our mission is to enable anyone to extract, enrich and integrate web data. The company helps mid to large organizations crafting the best process for specific needs, whether it‚Äôs extracting leads, enriching them, extracting job ads to identify companies, and much more. Captain Data provides more than a hundred automations, with countless ways to create workflows thanks to their unique no-code ‚Äúworkflow editor‚Äù.

description_entreprise: At Spinergie, we aim to help decarbonize maritime activities and develop renewable marine energies. Protecting our oceans is an exciting, complex, and urgent challenge. So we mobilize our collective intelligence and proprietary algorithms to transform millions of data points into useful information. Spinergie provides a SaaS monitoring and analysis solution for our customers to better manage their operations and reduce their carbon emissions.

intitule: Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer (L6), EU Hardlines Private Brands
description: Amazon Hardlines Private Brands is looking for a motivated Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer. WW Hardlines Private Brands Business Intelligence team powers the automation and influences the insight of newly created brands and products Worldwide. We need leaders who are owners, have a bias for action, and possess a deep analytical desire to deliver results. The successful candidate will demonstrate strong business acumen, experience in developing reporting and analytical infrastructures, strong communication skills, an ability to work effectively with cross functional teams in a fast paced environment and highly ambiguous work space.  As a Sr. BIE in the team you will own our analytical tools, be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data warehouse and build new business intelligence solutions end-to-end. You‚Äôll work directly across all teams to provide valuable data-driven insights and recommendations. You will create reporting and analysis that the business will use to measure all aspects of operational performance, and drive both incremental improvement to existing tools and processes and large scale changes in our tools, user interfaces, processes and overall business organization.You will use your experience to develop solutions including ETLs, Quicksight dashboards, R Shiny applications and prototype Machine Learning in applications related to Business, Deals, Supply Chain and Pricing.   We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Paris (FRA), Luxembourg (LUX), London (UK). Key job responsibilities 1. Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards and data solutions that will support our analytical and business needs. 2. Identify technical solutions to solve the business problem including evaluation of platform/dashboard required, technical solution review, data design approach review, validation, code review, UAT testing and launch in line with best practices 3. Independently drive projects and prioritization between projects to earn trust from stakeholders 4. Drive seamless data/reporting and insights to enable data backed decision making,  and drive leadership clarity around business metrics by enabling MBRs/QBRs/Pillar reviews/OP1 discussions.  5. Drive yearly roadmap of automation projects for the function/pillar after collection of OP1 requests and alignment on prioritization (ATL/BTL) with Leadership/Mgmt team.  6. Drive documentation of your designs (e.g., System Design, Functional Design, Data Flow Design) clearly articulating trade-offs in solution decisions and choices. 7. Use data science/statistical modelling tools in partnership with other BIEs and Data Scientists to develop next generation analytics. A day in the life The day in the life of a BIE would involve managing multiple BI projects in a particular/multiple domains (across business, pricing, deals or supply chain) for WW HPB across various stages of different projects. Day-to-day activities to include meetings across stakeholders on understanding business requirements, connecting with fellow BIEs to identify source data tables, brainstorming with Private Brand Intelligence (PBI) Tech team on potential technical solutions/actions, data design review with BIEs, sprint prioritization reviews, code review through Maestro with fellow BIEs and driving trainings/documentation/launch announcement as we get into launch.  We aim to work 70% of the time on Roadmap projects while the other 30% is dedicated to maintenance tasks and solving issues we could have in some of our data pipelines or data products. Those data products can vary from QuickSight Dashboards to Web Applications or simple Excel Reports. You as a BIE in the WW HPB BI team would focus on operational excellence: constructively identifying quality issues, proposing solutions when necessary, taking on projects that improve the team‚Äôs BI solutions, and making them better and easier to maintain. You use your expertise and knowledge of the business and its technologies to drive insightful discussions with customers and can anticipate (acting as the analytics partner for the business) ‚Äîand possibly influence‚Äîtheir future requirements. You are expected to show good judgment when making trade-offs between your team‚Äôs investment (e.g. team prioritization, data retention policy, infrastructure costs) and the business need. About the team The mission of Hardlines Private Brands (HPB) is to build the most trusted and loved brands on Amazon, improving the customer experience and driving incremental profit for Amazon. We deliver a product assortment that offers incremental value for customers in terms of sustainability, reliability, safety, availability, price and speed compared to competitive products, which reinforces Amazon‚Äôs low price-high value perception and drives repeat store visits. We drive growth and profitability by clearly communicating to our customers through a streamlined brand which gives a clear signal to customers that they can buy with confidence, making faster and easier purchase decisions amidst the vast array of similar products sold in Amazon‚Äôs stores. The BI team in WW HPB team works along with world-wide BI teams (based out of NA/CN/JP) to develop data/insight solutions for driving data backed business decisions.  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Clichy, FRA

description: Akur8 is a young, dynamic, fast growing Insurtech startup that is revolutionizing insurance pricing with transparent AI. Since 2016 our skilled R&D team of Data Scientists, Software Engineers and Actuaries has developed unique AI algorithms that automate the insurance pricing process in an unprecedented way. Our solution is a SaaS platform which allows insurance companies to model their risks 10 times faster, with a higher predictive power than traditional methods. constituting a major game changer for the insurance industry. Akur8 has been already been selected: In CB Insights Top 50 World Insurtech Companies 2022 In Fintech Global‚Äôs Top 100 AIFinTech list 2022 As No.24 in S√∏nr‚Äôs World Top 100 Insurtech Companies 2022 As 3rd best overall (worldwide) in the CodinGame 2022 Software Engineering Fall Challenge With 31 nationalities within our team, and offices in Paris, London, New York, Tokyo, Milan & Cologne, Akur8‚Äôs solution is international by design. Servicing 85 clients across 3 continents and targeting all non-life insurance carriers, we focus on more mature markets for faster expansion. To learn more about Akur8, and what we do, click  here . Akur8 is, in all senses of the term, an equal opportunities employer. Akur8 puts diversity and inclusion at the heart of its values. We examine all applications based on equal skills and applying the principles of non-discrimination. We are looking for a talented Engineer with a strong interest in Software Engineering and Machine Learning to join us and contribute to the development of our actuarial pricing platform.  Your mission will be to build and implement technical features in the software and optimize its data structures. These features answer clear business purposes for insurance Risk Managers and Product Managers, meaning that a good understanding of modelling, maths and logic are necessary for the accomplishment of the mission. At Akur8 our Python, Java and Angular stack leverages the AWS cloud in order to solve the machine learning and insurance pricing problems that our users face on a daily basis. You‚Äôll be fully involved in the heart of our platform, learning every day and seeing the impact of your work in production. Amongst your daily responsibilities, you‚Äôll be required to: Lead the development of challenging product features Interact with the design and product teams to help transform their needs into well-structured tasks that fit into our Agile development framework. Design, build, integrate and maintain efficient, reusable and reliable code Understand our data models and machine learning algorithms to optimise their computation with the different cloud services within AWS. Your role in integrating our machine learning with our software, with a focus on robustness and computational performance, will assist in implementing a best-in-class platform that enables insurance companies to reduce their modelling time and premium creation exponentially, whilst at the same time providing the added advantage of improving their predictive power / accuracy. Requirements We're looking for an innovative and rigorous mind that has a solid technical background and a track record of helping their team grow. You have just completed or are finishing your PhD in computer science, applied mathematics or related topic; You understand client's priorities and have a good sense of urgency to find the right balance between need for fast delivery and code robustness; You are interested in machine learning and have good knowledge of maths and/or statistics; You have experience in software engineering standards, testing, code reviews and system design; Having high-level knowledge of AWS‚Äôs main services is a plus (EC2, ECS, RDS, S3, Athena). Important: You must possess an employment status: French or Schengen area nationality or a ‚Äòcarte de s√©jour‚Äô that will allow you to work from our Paris office. We are equally open to the visa sponsorship of non-EU candidates as long as they are already in possession of their final diploma / attestation of their final academic results. Benefits As a newcomer, you'll be joining a diverse, highly skilled and motivated team, with a strong Tech DNA, colleagues that are eager to share their knowledge and passion. But it‚Äôs not all work, you‚Äôll also be part of a dynamic team that enjoys spending time together and having fun, including karaoke, team lunches, playing sports as well as the occasional ‚Äòhappy hour‚Äô. In addition to this, we will provide you with: Competitive salary + annual bonus Company shares / equity Hybrid office / home office policy 25 days of paid holidays + RTT Gym membership with Gymlib On-site gym facilities / corporate sporting activities Excellent health insurance (including possibility of family coverage) Swile lunch vouchers  Public transportation reimbursement + sustainable mobility allowance Relocation support Sponsored cr√®che access Free cafeteria with fresh fruit, drinks and snacks Great office in the heart of the 9th arrondissement of Paris

And as the only solution on the market reconciling Machine Learning and Actuarial worlds, insurance carriers‚Äô modelling time is divided by 10 and loss ratio is improved by 2%-4%.

description: Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 650 people, powering operations in 21 countries (and counting!). Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps  lower our collective environmental impact . We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014. Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech. About our Data Tribe : Can you build bridges between the business and the data world? Do you like to inspire the business with your data know-how? Can you translate business needs into data use cases and lead them to success? Do you want to have a meaningful impact through your job? Here is your opportunity. As an  analytics engineer,  you will work on a daily basis with data engineers, BI analysts, developers, and business teams to build and maintain the source of truth of our data model. You‚Äôll be responsible for : Building and maintaining the core source of truth of the company: the one that is transversal to the whole company Challenging the vision of the data model, i.e. what are the core concepts at Back Market and how to represent them, based on your keen business eye fuelled with exchange with BI and business partners  Designing a data model that scales thanks to your architecture skills Mentoring the BI on building their source of truth on their specialized scope, e.g. finance, care‚Ä¶, while respecting your good practices In the end, you will be one of the key players in the adoption of the self-service of data in the company. The quality of the data in your data model thanks to your rigor and communication: you are building the source of truth of the company, and every change needs to be controlled and properly advertised You are ready to follow and accompany the change, from a team organization point of view, work methods, pace of delivery etc‚Ä¶ You're perfect for this role if : A strong experience (4 years and more) as a technical data analyst / BI, during which you built some data models. Bonus points if you already have experience in the marketplace / scale ups You have a technical, analytical or scientific educational background (e.g. data analysis, business intelligence) or comparable professional experience You know your way around python, enough to adapt existing logic You are expert in SQL You have worked with Google Analytics data before You have no problem with navigating ambiguous situations and have a profound problem-solver attitude using data and the user at the center of all your thoughts Your great communication and interpersonal skills help you in building strong relationships and handling business stakeholders and top management expectations You are rigorous, humble, curious and proactive.  Team spirit is essential for you English is a no brainer, we are an international team. Recruitment Process - Call with Yann one of our tech talent acquisition specialist  - At home case study about one of our team challenge - Tech Interview with the team - 2h with one data analytic engineer and one data engineer - Team Fit interview with your future Manager and product stakeholder - Back Market Values fit interview #LI-YP1 WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? -  A meaningful job:  you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts! -  A meaningful company : we became a mission-driven company in January 2022. -  Be part of a worldwide growing company  based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face  great challenges :  you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas! -  Work alongside passionate experts:   who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.  -  Grow your career : with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1! -  Leadership Academy by Back Market: ‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart. -  An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including :  Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶ -  One Loving Tribe:  you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.  - Be part of one of our  Employee Resource Groups  createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.  -  Several internal events:  The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual). -  We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE:  It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact. Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team. Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

description: Context on the Data Integration Data is a cornerstone for Seyna. Data will allow us to differentiate ourselves from our competition and it will help us protect the future of our insurance company. This can only become true if our data is of high quality, and efficiently processed. We exchange with more partners daily: we receive data from the brokers and distributors that sell our products, then analyze and process it, before sharing our results and insights with our ecosystem. Exchanging data with our partners presents an increasing challenge as our business grows : increasing volume, data diversity, and increasingly diverse sources. The Data Integration Manager makes sure exchanging data with Seyna is as easy for our partners, while still meeting our internal requirements. She also owns the quality of the data - checking that the data we received is correct. Your Missions: As a Data Integration Manager you will : Help our partners with their data integration process (onboarding and run) Design custom APIs on a day-to-day basis, for each new partner integrating with Seyna Work with our Data Engineer to make the integration as easy as possible. Collect the partner‚Äôs data. If not fully automated, you integrate it yourself into Seyna‚Äôs ecosystem. Check data consistency regarding accounting & business rules (e.g. premium acquisition rate vs receipt emission, reinsurance cession rate, written premium vs receipt emission‚Ä¶) Automate the data quality process and make it more efficient Assist the team with the data monitoring and data analysis Shape the future of data integration at Seyna ! Our Current Stack Data integration Deployed on AWS with AWS CDK (IaC) Coded in Python

And they‚Äôre off to a great start. The leadership team includes experienced operators from insurance and high growth technology companies. They have a very ambitious mission with tough problems to work on. It‚Äôll only be possible if we have the best team. Join us !

description: Skillup is looking for a  Lead Developer  to join our  Data team ! At Skillup, the role of a Lead Developer encompasses coaching, management, as well as designing, coding, and operating our suite of modules. We understand that, first and foremost, Lead Developers at Skillup are  individual contributors who lead by example . As a senior individual contributor, you are willing to take the lead and go the distance WITH your team. Your commitment to hands-on coding, along with your leadership responsibilities, helps drive the success of our projects and the growth of our team. Your future missions as a lead will be focused on: Tech and Product At Skillup, the Lead Developer is a key player in software development and maintenance. You‚Äôll code, set goals, and solve problems while bridging tech and product teams. Quick reporting and continuous improvement are essential. Your role also includes staying updated on tech trends to keep the team agile and ready for future challenges. You‚Äôll work closely with Product Managers to turn high-level business goals into actionable plans, adapting as priorities shift. Processes As Lead Developer at Skillup, you‚Äôll maintain high standards in processes and quality while enhancing collaboration with external teams like Operations. Open communication and a strong feedback loop within your team are key. You‚Äôll use your expertise to shape projects, work closely with Product Managers, and adapt to changing priorities. A crucial part of your role is to effectively qualify tasks, guiding task prioritization, resource allocation, and work distribution among the team. MOST IMPORTANTLY , your role as a Lead Developer is not just about ticking off tasks; it is about setting the pace and leading by example. In the spirit of a ‚Äòcollective mission‚Äô, you are not above the team but a part of it. Every member of the team shall feel equally responsible for all the tasks described above, and that is also part of your mission. People As a Lead Developer at Skillup, your leadership extends to mentoring and guiding team members, helping them grow through coaching and feedback. You‚Äôll actively contribute to recruitment efforts, aligning them with team needs and company culture. Your role in people management includes conducting regular one-on-one meetings and annual interviews, as well as providing input for salary reviews. Your focus on individual growth and alignment with organizational goals ensures a cohesive and thriving team. YOU WILL MATTER AT SKILLUP We are convinced that everyone has a role to play at Skillup. We can‚Äôt wait to work with you and see what you will bring to the team! In the company Along with your fellow Technical Leaders, you will be responsible of the integration of the Data team with the rest of the Tech Feature teams and harmonizing Data load/restitution best practices. Propagate a data-driven culture across the organization: Conduct training sessions and workshops to awke other teams, executives, and other stakeholders on the value of data-driven decision-making. Foster a sense of curiosity and enthusiasm for data exploration throughout the company. With your team working in the following projects: Transversal projects with feature teams to build orchestrated customer data pipelines NLP projects with feature teams to build AI/ML features Scraping pipeline and tooling for on-the-shelf training catalog Internal tooling for operational teams to configure and operate data pipelines Maintain, improve and scale our data infrastructure and developer experience YOUR FUTURE WORK ENVIRONMENT Your team As a Lead Developer in the Data team at Skillup, you will be a part of the Product and Tech department. The Data team is responsible for designing, building, and operating tools and infrastructure related to data imports, restitution, scrapping, and reporting. The Product and Tech department At Skillup the Product and Tech department is composed of 4 feature teams and 1 data team. Each team is ideally composed of 1 PM, 1 Lead and 4 Developers. Alongside the teams we have 2 UX members, 1 Head of Engineering, 1 Head of Product and 1 Product Strategist. Our CTO completes our list of team members. As a Lead developer you will be also part of our team of Skillup Lead Developers managed by our Head of Engineering. Key Stakeholders You will work closely with your team members, PM, Lead Developers, Product Strategist, Head of Engineering, Head of Product, and CTO to build tools that satisfy the needs of our external and internal customers, such as the Ops team, using the data and tools produced by the Data team. The Data team‚Äôs technical Stack Data engineering:  Python, Scrapy, Pandas, Postgresql, MongoDB, Neo4j, Zyte, Airflow, Dash/ Plotly, S3 NLP/Machine Learning:  scikit-learn, spaCy, pyTorch, fastText, XGBoost, transformers/BERT, GRU

description: Deepki, leading the way in ESG SaaS for real estate owners and accelerating the transition towards net zero and sustainability. (we are sensitive to the quality of what we produce). Why join Deepki? More about Deepki Founded in 2014, Deepki supports real estate players in their transition to net zero and sustainability. Deepki is the only company in the world offering a fully-populated ESG data intelligence platform combined with expert advisory services. Deepki has offices across Europe, in Paris, London, Madrid, Milan and Berlin, with ambitious expansion plans. Key Figures 400M+ sqm monitored 50+ countries where we operate 400+ references across the world  400+ employees globally  We are looking for talented individuals that share our drive and motivation to accelerate real estate‚Äôs environmental transition at an international scale! Our team represents a mixture of different backgrounds and experiences, working together to ensure the best possible customer experience. Do you feel like you meet most requirements, but not all of them? We want to hear from you! Deepki is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: OUR VALUE CHAIN TEAM IS SEEKING FOR A SENIOR DATA MANAGER, BASED IN LILLE or PARIS.  Data Value Chain is a key part of the Value Chain organization at Decathlon. Soft skills also required for this role: - Demonstrable experience on people management  - Proactive on helping people to grow, effective mentorship and coaching - Very good communication skills WHAT YOU GET 2 days remote working per week; The option of working in one of Decathlon Digital's offices in Lille or Paris or Amsterdam Free choice of working tool (Mac, Windows, Chromebooks) A local project team and within a global network (international career path) Skills development and mentoring (diversity of projects, technical certifications from the first year, internal and external training, etc.). Remuneration package (employee share ownership, monthly/quarterly bonuses) DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT  What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. That‚Äôs why we are embarking on a journey to create a more sustainable tech model, reducing our direct environmental impact while maintaining a safe, diverse, and inclusive space for all our people to learn and thrive together. Team up with us to design the digital future of sports.

description: OUR VALUE CHAIN TEAM IS SEEKING FOR A SENIOR DATA MANAGER, BASED IN LILLE or PARIS.  Data Value Chain is a key part of the Value Chain organization at Decathlon. Our mission is to uncover the power of AI and analytics to drive data transformation in order to ensure a state-of-the-art Value Chain at Decathlon. MSc or Phd in Data Science is required. -Excellent research and innovation skills.  -High level of industry acumen in the Supply Chain area for retailing, particularly related to forecasting and planning.  Soft skills also required for this role: - Demonstrable experience on people management  - Proactive on helping people to grow, effective mentorship and coaching - Very good communication skills WHAT YOU GET 2 days remote working per week; The option of working in one of Decathlon Digital's offices in Lille or Paris or Amsterdam Free choice of working tool (Mac, Windows, Chromebooks) A local project team and within a global network (international career path) Skills development and mentoring (diversity of projects, technical certifications from the first year, internal and external training, etc.). Remuneration package (employee share ownership, monthly/quarterly bonuses) DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT  What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. Together, we are creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences and product second life. Changing the game for good . We are in this for the love of sports. And like everything we love, we want it to last. That‚Äôs why we are embarking on a journey to create a more sustainable tech model, reducing our direct environmental impact while maintaining a safe, diverse, and inclusive space for all our people to learn and thrive together. Team up with us to design the digital future of sports.

description: As a  Data Business Intelligence Developer with a minimum of 2 years experience , you will assume a pivotal role within the ORIS organization, utilizing  data, business intelligence best practices and tools  to generate valuable insights and facilitate  well-informed decision-making . Your responsibilities will cover the  entire BI process , including data loading and processing, the development of key performance indicators, and the creation of dashboards with Tableau. Your missions will be: Data Collection, cleaning and transformation Gather data from various sources, such as databases, APIs, or web scraping. Organize and manage datasets in a datalake. Data Visualization and reporting Design and develop dashboards, reports and visualizations, providing data insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Prepare business oriented datasets for ad-hoc analysis. Publish reports to internal and external customers, embed the reports in our SaaS platform, and manage user permissions Project Management and stakeholder collaboration Collaborate with various stakeholders to understand their data needs and requirements. Scope, plan, and execute BI projects to meet deadlines and objectives. Train business users and colleagues to effectively use BI solutions. Data Analysis Explore the datasets and identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Define and track Key Performance Indicators to assess the performance of various business processes and departments. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders based on data analysis. Strategic Guidance and continuous improvement Stay updated on the latest business intelligence methodologies, tools and technologies. Promote the use of indicators and a data-driven culture.

description: Mirakl is the global leader in platform business innovation. Mirakl's suite of solutions provides enterprises with a transformative way to drive significant growth and efficiency in their online business. Since 2012, Mirakl has been pioneering the platform economy, empowering retail and b2b enterprises with the most advanced, secure and scalable technology to digitize and expand product assortment through marketplace and dropship, improve efficiency in supplier catalog management and payments, personalize shopping experiences, and boost profits through retail media. Mirakl is trusted by 400+ industry-leading businesses worldwide including Macy‚Äôs, Decathlon, Kroger, Airbus, Toyota Material Handling and Sonepar. Headquartered in Paris and Boston and with offices in 7 countries, Mirakl is recognized as a Great Place to Work company. As the Chief Data and Artificial Intelligence Officer reporting into the CEO, you will lead the strategic direction for data management and AI initiatives. You will be responsible for driving the company's data strategy, ensuring optimal data governance and usage, and promoting a data-driven culture. You will also champion the integration of AI - in our products and throughout the company - ensuring alignment with business goals, driving innovation, and ensuring the ethical and responsible use of AI. This position is open for Paris office, with 2 days remote possible per week. Key Responsibilities Define and align AI and data strategy  across the company, including governance, management, and applications. Ensure alignment with the company's overall business objectives.  Set-up and manage data & AI operations , including:  Team Management (~25 people) : Build, mentor, and lead high-performing teams in data science, AI research, DevOps and data engineering. AI Integration and performance analytic s: Lead the integration of AI and ML technologies into business processes, products, and services. Monitor and assess new AI technologies for potential adoption. Define and refine metrics to measure the tangible impact of AI-driven projects, ensuring our data strategy consistently aligns with business objectives. Data Governance and Compliance : Oversee the development and implementation of data governance policies and best practices, ensuring data accuracy, security, and compliance. Analytics and Insights : Lead the business intelligence team in deriving actionable insights from data. Empower decision-makers across the company with relevant data and analytics tools. Impulse and coordinate an AI and data culture throughout the organization  in line with our values:  Innovation : Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in the data and AI landscape. Foster an environment of innovation at Mirakl, ensuring that we remain at the cutting edge of data usage and AI application in the ecommerce sector. Collaboration : Work closely with all business units to ensure seamless integration of AI-driven solutions and data-backed strategies.  Ethical AI : Advocate for and implement best practices related to the ethical and responsible use of AI, ensuring transparency, fairness, and avoiding bias. Stakeholder Communication : Act as the primary point of contact for all data and AI-related matters, ensuring clear communication with senior management, board members, and other key stakeholders. Our Data Stack: Python, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, Databricks, Spark, Aws (Amazon Redshift, s3, etc.), SQL, Airflow, Delta Lake Required Qualifications and Experience: Proven experience in a senior data and/or AI leadership role with a track record of successfully implementing data and AI strategies in a corporate environment. Ability to bridge the gap between data science and business strategy, translating AI and ML capabilities into tangible business outcomes.  Broad knowledge of modern AI technologies, data governance standards Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire teams and drive change. Exceptional communication skills, adept at translating complex AI and data concepts to a broad audience. Understanding of ethical considerations in AI and a commitment to promoting responsible AI practices. Fluent level of French is required to communicate with our tech teams Good level of English as we are a worldwilde company We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you‚Äôre ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you‚Äôre not an exact match.

description: Roles starting from June 2024 in France. At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Data Center Engineering Operations Intern The Data Center Engineering Operations (DCEO) Team is the backbone of AWS, supporting the rapid growth of AWS business and customers 24x7. We commit to maintain the physical critical facility infrastructure of AWS and ensure the standards for operational performance in the areas of safety, security, availability, productivity, capacity, efficiency and cost. Interns will work in an Amazon Data Center and will provide technical support, including risk management and mitigation, corrective and preventative maintenance of critical facility infrastructure, vendor management and metrics reporting. Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks. Candidates must be able to provide an internship agreement from their university. Intern schedules are typically day schedules, Monday-Friday. A full time position could involve day, evening, or weekend shifts and on-call rotations.  Amazon does not sponsor for immigration for this role. Note: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that we are reviewing a high volume of applications and appreciate your patience.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members in an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Projects and tasks are assigned in a way that leverages your strengths and helps you further develop your skillset.  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Key job responsibilities ¬∑ Maintain mechanical and electrical equipment ¬∑ Assist root cause analysis of equipment failures ¬∑ Assist in troubleshooting of facility and rack-level events within internal SLA ¬∑ Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment ¬∑ Utilize internal CMMS to manage building workflows ¬∑ Interact with third party vendors & contractors who are working on site A day in the life https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LTgCHTdRed0 About  the team The Engineering Operations team is Amazon‚Äôs front-line responders for hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operations. You will work with equipment that supports mission-critical servers and must maintain better than 99.999% uptime. This equipment includes, but is not limited to, stand-by diesel generators, switchgear, UPS‚Äôs, PDU‚Äôs, AHU‚Äôs, chillers, cooling towers, chemical treatment systems, pumps, motors, VFD‚Äôs, and building automation systems. description_entreprise: Stago is a French company in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry with international activities. With operations in 18 countries, it has nearly 2,600 employees, half of whom are based out of France. Stago is an independent, privately-owned company that brings together all skills and know-how in the field of biology and instrumentation to develop, manufacture and market the widest range of reagents and instruments for hemostasis analysis throughout the world. Using the most advanced computer, electronic and biological technologies, Stago invests in research and innovation to develop ever more effective reagents, instruments and diagnostic solutions. With more than 350 products on the market, Stago is a world leader in In Vitro Diagnostics and a preferred partner of medical laboratories. Customer satisfaction is a strong value and everyone is aware that behind their actions there is a patient.

description: Tu trouveras ci dessous les sujets de stage que nous proposons sur la th√©matique Data Science et IA. description: Valtech is on the lookout for a Snowflake Data Architect m/f/d. Do you have deep expertise in designing, implementing, and managing data solutions using Snowflake's cloud data platform? Are you keen to work within an international team and be directly involved with our clients? If you're ready to make a strategic impact and drive transformational change, you might be just who we're looking for! A day in the life of a Snowflake Data Architect As a Snowflake Data Architect at Valtech, your role extends beyond the technical sphere - it also encompasses strategic advising and teamwork. You'll work together with our clients, applying your deep understanding of Snowflake's data platform to guide them towards improved business decisions and strategies. Internally, you'll collaborate closely with our team of data engineers and data strategy consultants, ensuring that your technical expertise and their strategic insights come together to forge robust, data-driven solutions. Here‚Äôs what you'll do day-to-day: Designing, advising on, and implementing scalable data architecture solutions using Snowflake, balancing hands-on work with strategic considerations. Building efficient data pipelines, workflows, and ETL processes. Troubleshooting data management systems, ensuring optimal performance, and fine-tuning as necessary. Preparing presentations to communicate your ideas and findings, both to clients and internal team members. Training junior consultants and clients on Snowflake best practices, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within the organization. Your profile You're a professional with at least 5 years of experience in data architecture, with substantial experience in Snowflake's data platform. You have a sound understanding of data structures, data pipelines, ETL processes, and a keen business sense that enables you to identify problems and develop data-driven solutions. You're comfortable interacting with clients and providing expert advice. We'd appreciate it if you have: Proven experience in designing and implementing data architectures in Snowflake. This is a must for the role. Strong knowledge of ETL processes, data warehousing solutions, and relational databases. Previous experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP. A deep understanding of SQL and other database technologies. Familiarity with data management principles, including data governance and data quality management. Excellent communication skills, capable of clearly explaining complex data architectures to non-technical stakeholders. Fluency in English. Flexibility to work on-site with clients across Europe. What we can offer you Besides these advantages, we offer you much more. For example, our skills development program will help you excel in your current field or explore new paths. You will also have the opportunity to participate in many internal initiatives. Whether it's helping to improve Valtech as a company or contributing to our impact on the world, we encourage our employees to pursue their professional and personal ambitions. Join Valtech By joining us, you will not only help us revolutionize the experience of our customers, you will become a real agent of change. At Valtech, we have ambitions that open up vast horizons: as we grow, new opportunities arise for you to take responsibility, bring your creative ideas to life and innovate to advance both our business and our customers. Ready to embark on the Valtech adventure by becoming our next Snowflake Data Architect? So apply today. We look forward to getting to know you!

description_entreprise: Yubo is a live social discovery app launched in 2015, with the ambition to create a space where Gen Z can belong, feel safe and make friends. With more than 70 million users worldwide across 140 countries, we celebrate the true essence of being young, and make it easy to connect with others wherever you are. We are a French Tech company, part of the Next120, and our mission is to inspire and enable a new generation to find out about the world and themselves. Yubo‚Äôs business model is different from other social networks: in-app purchases and subscriptions. Yubo‚Äôs growth relies on paid UA, not virality. Our objective is to become the safest social app in the world. Indeed, as leading platform for young people to socialize online, we have a special responsibility towards our community to building a safe digital space, and we take it very seriously. Safety is at the core of our DNA, and we have developed and implemented a wide range of safeguards in the app. We also work closely with the broader technology industry, NGOs and charities to create industry-leading child protection standards. We really have a proactive approach to protect, support and educate.

description: Created in 2013, Lydia quickly became the reference for payment between friends. The French fintech has gained great notoriety for this feature and now has more than 7 million users.In recent years, Lydia has developed other services - pot, current account, common account, savings, credit, investment... to become the daily and complete payment application for millions of French people. With 250 employees based in Paris, Nantes, Bordeaux and Lyon, Lydia has set itself the task of changing the codes of the bank by offering all the essential services to manage your money on a daily basis through a simple, accessible and enjoyable customer experience. As the Head of data, you will define a data strategy & vision that unlock the potential of our data assets while ensuring compliance, security and privacy. You will be responsible for developing and implementing data solutions that will help our company achieve its strategic objectives. Additionally, you will be responsible for influencing and inspiring all members of our organization to use data the right way in order to make better decisions. What you will do: Develop a compelling data vision and strategy that will help our company achieve its strategic objectives. Define and implement data governance policies and procedures, establishing standards for data collection, storage, security, and privacy. Develop and execute the data governance strategy for the company, aligning it with the overall business objectives and goals of the organization. Lead and mentor a team of data science, data engineering, and analytics engineers, fostering their professional growth and driving them towards excellence. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities where data can play a critical role in generating actionable insights and driving informed decision-making. Oversee the design and implementation of data-driven solutions, ensuring the utilization of best practices and cutting-edge technologies. Develop and maintain scalable data infrastructure, including data pipelines, data lakes, and databases, while ensuring data quality and integrity. Drive the adoption of advanced analytics techniques, machine learning, and predictive modeling to generate valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making. Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and advancements in the data field, identifying opportunities for innovation and driving Drive a data-driven culture across the organization, providing training and resources, and fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.continuous improvement within the team. Communicate data vision, strategy, progress, challenges, and opportunities to exco, advocating for necessary resources and support to drive the data strategy. You are in the right place if you have : Proven experience in a leadership data role with a track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions. Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams and effectively communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong knowledge of data management principles, data architecture, and data engineering practices. Deep understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and advanced analytics methodologies. Proven experience in developing and implementing data strategies, driving organizational change, and promoting a data-driven culture. Experience working in a startup or fast-paced environment, demonstrating agility, resilience, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Hiring process : Hiring process in 4 steps: Step 1: Interview with the talent acquisition team Step 2: Interview with the CTO Step 3: Technical case with team members Step 4: Exec interviews
secteur_activite: Mobile Apps, Banking

description: Are you interested in working at the business end of Aerospace, where airline brand meets innovative passenger experience? Then your next opportunity could be with Safran Seats, an industry award winning, premium designer and manufacturer of First and Business Class seating and technology. Our passenger experience prides itself on innovation, customisation, quality and industrial design. At Safran Seats, we are unique within aerospace, as we interface with both the world's biggest airlines and airframers alike, with the largest seats portfolio of all seats suppliers. One day you could be liaising with one of the world's largest airframers, and the next, some of the biggest airline brands around the world! In the UK, Safran Seats specialises solely in the First Class and Business Class seating markets for wide body aircraft, with industrial and engineering teams in Cwmbran and Newport, Wales and Brackley, England. At Safran Seats, we are now recruiting for an Aftermarket Customer Support Engineer to join our team in Newport. Working as part of the growing aftermarket engineering team to investigate and create concept solutions for customer technical enquiries, you will ensure that all issues are closed efficiently and effectively. In this job role, you will proactively support the customer as the primary function to ensure that the engineering service levels provided maintains customer satisfaction for the entire Safran Seats portfolio. Key Responsibilities & Duties will include; ‚Ä¢    Support the customers in service operations, maintain regular communications and resolve all customer concerns within planned timescales.  ‚Ä¢    Log, investigate and coordinate root cause analysis reviews to understand cause of in service failures.  ‚Ä¢  Participate in design reviews of new product development, to ensure lessons learned are applied to new designs to reduce ISI's.  ‚Ä¢  Provide engineering support to the Part 145 Facility and Sales team. ‚Ä¢  Identify product improvements and service offerings that enhance customer satisfaction and business margins.  ‚Ä¢ Minimise impact of product failure to our customers.  ‚Ä¢ Minimise warranty & rework costs.  ‚Ä¢    Provide a daily technical query/answer support service to our customers (if required).  ‚Ä¢   Act as a technical point of contact with our aftermarket customers.

description_entreprise: Look Up Space a l‚Äôambition de devenir un leader mondial de la surveillance de l‚Äôespace et de la s√©curit√© des activit√©s en orbites terrestres. Look Up Space, d√©veloppe une capacit√© souveraine r√©pondant √† ces enjeux de s√©curit√© civile et de d√©fense dans l‚Äôespace. Cette capacit√© qui repose sur un r√©seau plan√©taire de radars de surveillance de l‚Äôespace et sur une architecture num√©rique, innovante, permet d‚Äôoffrir aux clients de Look Up Space un large √©ventail de services √† forte valeur ajout√©e.   Look a √©t√© fond√©e en juin 2022 par Juan Carlos Dolado (expert reconnu internationalement dans le domaine de la surveillance de l‚Äôespace). Juan Carlos dirigeait les activit√©s de surveillance de l‚Äôespace au CNES avant de cr√©er Look Up Space et Michel Friedling, g√©n√©ral de l‚Äôarm√©e de l‚Äôair et de l‚Äôespace, qui a mont√© et dirig√© le Commandement de l‚ÄôEspace, responsable des op√©rations spatiales militaires et de la politique spatiale militaire fran√ßaise.

description: Safran Aircraft Engines dispose d'un r√©seau d'atelier de maintenance des moteurs civils √† travers le monde et propose √† ses clients une gamme compl√®te d'interventions : restauration de performances, remplacement de pi√®ces √† dur√©e de vie limit√©e, inspection et maintenance de l'ensemble du moteur et de ses √©quipements.
