description: What we do Join a team of passionate and hard working entrepreneurs to transform healthcare! Working in the tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams in an agile environment, while collaborating with engineering, design, and business teams. What you‚Äôll do We are looking for an Engineering Manager in Nantes to join our Clinical Platform domain.  Your role as Engineering Manager: You will be both a technical leader and a people manager, coaching and training your team members while building an amazing engineering organization at Doctolib. In this role, you will: Be directly in charge of a team of full -stack developers; Manage and grow the performance and career of your team; Ensure business objectives are met as a team, by driving performance of each team member; Empower your team to build better products; Set the roadmap for your team, and be the end -to -end owner of the team‚Äôs production, quality, and delivery; Participate in code reviews and be hands -on if required; Lead cross functional initiatives to up -level our engineering team; Partner with Talent & People teams to recruit, develop and retain talent. Who you are If you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply! Have 4+ years of people management experience with an engineering team; Are eager to be hands on with our stack: we do use React, Ruby on Rails and NestJS (and we are happy to help you ramp up); You understand the value of testing your code; Have the ability to adapt to the most efficient technologies to solve issues; Have proven experiences developing efficient, maintainable and secure products; Are comfortable speaking English in your day by day with the team Now, it would be fantastic if you: Have a great understanding of cloud infrastructures and security topics; What we offer A stock -option program for each Doctoliber A competitive health insurance paid 100% by the company  A dedicated onboarding program  - the Doctolib Academy Mental health and wellbeing offer in partnership with moka.care The Doctolib Parent Care Program, including extended parental leave, meet -ups and inspiring conferences A subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative class  Subsidy for lunch and various food offers in our offices  A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office -based mode  Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year The interview process Recruiter Call  Feature Building Interview  System Design Interview  Management Interview  Immersion Offer! Job details   Permanent position Full time Location: Nantes  Working mode: hybrid (2/3 days per week in the office) Start Date: as soon as possible If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest  Medium blog articles ! At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone  - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it! The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!  All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click  here . If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at  hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com .
secteur_activite: Mobile Apps, Software, SaaS / Cloud Services, Health
description_entreprise: Doctolib is a purpose-led company that strives for a healthier world with more than 2,800 employees across France, Italy, and Germany. Since 2013, Doctolib has been improving the daily lives of more than 340,000 healthcare professionals by providing them with new-generation technology and services.  Doctolib also serves more than 70 million patients, offering a fast, frictionless and secure journey for all their care needs.

description: üî• Our Ops Department They are the dynamic force that supports Joko! The main missions of the Ops Department are to provide stellar customer support thanks to the Care Team, unlock insights from mountains of data with the Data Team, and orchestrate seamless processes thanks to the Business Ops Team. Led by Quentin, our COO, they form an unstoppable unit, igniting excellence throughout Joko. üéØ What You Will Do As a  Business Operations Engineer , you will build and operate entire business units and coordinate multiple teams to deliver strategic initiatives for the company. Leveraging your 360¬∞ view of Joko‚Äôs business operations, you will continuously optimize and automate processes to ensure Joko operates at the highest level of efficiency. You are an Engineer at heart but you also have a knack for process design and strategic project management. Process design and technical implementation . Razor-focused on execution and efficiency, you will work hand in hand with all of our teams (Product, Engineering, Sales, Customer Service, Account Management, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to ensure we have the best tools and processes in order to be efficient and scalable in our operations. Your role will be twofold: Gathering feedback and needs from all teams at Joko, you will design and take ownership of the processes addressing them. Whenever possible, you will automate those processes by writing feature specifications and prioritizing which ones to implement. You will then be responsible to implement these internal features from A to Z across the entire technical stack, putting on your Software Engineer hat and in full ownership. All of this with the goal of helping the whole organization improve its performance indicators, save time, and reduce risks. Project management.  You will lead and coordinate strategic projects with multiple stakeholders, be they internal departments or external partners, to ensure smooth and efficient delivery. Such projects will include - but the list is not exhaustive - the rollout of new business lines and features, the launch of new countries, and transverse projects aimed at improving the company‚Äôs operational and financial performance. You are expected to be a driving force in defining which strategic projects need to be launched. You will be part of the Operations team (working with other Business Operations Analysts/Engineers, Data Analysts, and Customer Care Experts) and you will report to the Business Operations Lead.

description_entreprise: At Joko, they leverage technology to help their users shop smarter: they help people preserve their purchasing power, buy more responsibly, and save time ‚Äî all at once. Their ambition is to have a positive impact on the everyday life of hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. To achieve that, they have built an app as well as a smart browser that provides users with: online and in-store cashback automatically applied coupon codes interest-free ‚Äòbuy now pay later‚Äô on any shopping website information on their purchases‚Äô carbon emissions and much more! Joko was created in 2018 by Xavier, Alexandre, and Nicolas and the team has reached great milestones already: 2m+ users 2000+ merchant partners ‚Ç¨12m+ raised from leading European investors 45 team members ‚Ç¨20b transactions processed to date

description: Position üîé In a nutshell, what are we looking for? We are looking for someone with a first experience in component based Front-End frameworks, preferably Angular (v.2 and higher) . Understand how Stockly works internally to add even more value to the company How e-commerce works, business models, used technology, problems retailers encounter every day How to use the best processes to keep the organization super efficient and to help you reach your objectives üî≠ Projection: At Stockly, you make the collective grow and we want to make you grow as well, what would be the next moves for you with us? Possibility to have a lot of weight over how we do things - we are still a young company Improving processes to help scale the team üíù About your future benefits Competitive packages : for this position, package range is typically  1500-2000‚Ç¨  depending on the profile (e.g. basic knowledge to expert). (e.g. basic knowledge to expert). We have a well defined and objective salary grid that is based on both  skills level  and  scarcity of profiles  üí∏ Meal vouchers  by Swile üçΩÔ∏è 50%  reimbursement of your  Navigo Pass  üöã A central and amazing  working environment  in  le Sentier  (Paris) üíº Flexible and  remote-friendly policy  üè° Possibility to take a  few paid days-off  to be discussed with Team Leader üèÑ Stockly dinners  together every other Thursday üçª Stockly breakfasts together  every other Friday ü•ê Coffee, tea and fruits  available everyday üçá Climbing, football & more  team üßó If your internship goes well for both you and Stockly, why not join us?  We are growing fast, there is space for every amazing people! ‚öôÔ∏è About how we work Every team has a  daily meeting  to align on priorities and solve issues ‚áí  You won‚Äôt be left alone! Every Monday we have a global  weekly meeting  where every team shares what they are working on and what they will do for the coming week ‚áí  You will have visibility on the whole company! Every quarter we have our  OKR meeting (Objectives, Key Results)  where each team shows the results of the previous quarter and the objectives of the following one ‚áí  You will see the company grow and your own role inside of it! During all these meetings  everyone can challenge  each other and all questions are more than welcome ‚áí  Transparency is one of our key values, and we are always open to new ideas!
secteur_activite: Software, E-commerce
description_entreprise: üî≠  Stockly  is a  tech-retail company  solving the supply/demand mismatch in e-commerce. description: What we do Join a team of passionate and hard working entrepreneurs to transform healthcare! Working in the tech team at Doctolib involves building innovative products and features to improve the daily lives of care teams and patients. We work in feature teams in an agile environment, while collaborating with engineering, design, and business teams. What you'll do Doctolib is seeking an Engineering Manager to join our Business Performance domain.  The Growth stream has two main missions:  Ensure Doctolib's growth through great user experience, referral programs, try -out sessions and clear value propositions Build tools to run prevention campaigns on our platform (B2C, B2B) and via other channels like email, push notification. Your role as Engineering Manager : You will be both a technical leader and a people manager, coaching and training your team members while building an amazing engineering organization at Doctolib. In this role, you will: Be directly in charge of a team of full -stack developers; Manage and grow the performance and career of your team; Ensure business objectives are met as a team, by driving performance of each team member; Empower your team to build better products; Set the roadmap for your team, and be the end -to -end owner of the team‚Äôs production, quality, and delivery; Participate in code reviews and be hands -on if required; Lead cross functional initiatives to up -level our engineering team; Partner with Talent & People teams to recruit, develop and retain talent. Who you are  Before you read on, if you don't have the exact profile described below, but you feel this job description matches your skill set, we still encourage you to apply! Have 4+ years of people management experience with an engineering team; Are eager to be hands on with our stack: we do use React, Ruby on Rails and NestJS (and we are happy to help you ramp up); You understand the value of testing your code; Have the ability to adapt to the most efficient technologies to solve issues; Have proven experiences developing efficient, maintainable and secure products; Are comfortable speaking English in your day by day with the team Now, it would be fantastic if you: Have a great understanding of cloud infrastructures and security topics; What we offer A stock -option program for each Doctoliber A competitive health insurance paid 100% by the company  A dedicated onboarding program  - the Doctolib Academy Mental health and wellbeing offer in partnership with moka.care The Doctolib Parent Care Program, including extended parental leave, meet -ups and inspiring conferences A subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative class  Subsidy for lunch and various food offers in our offices  A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office -based mode  Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year The interview process Phone screen with a Tech Recruiter  Live coding interview  System Design interview  Methodology interview  Half day immersion Job details Permanent Position  Full time  Location: Nantes Working Mode: Hybrid (3 days office based)  Start Date: As soon as possible If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest  Medium blog articles !  At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone  - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it! The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!  All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click  here . If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at  hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com .
secteur_activite: Mobile Apps, Software, SaaS / Cloud Services, Health
description_entreprise: Doctolib is a purpose-led company that strives for a healthier world with more than 2,800 employees across France, Italy, and Germany. Since 2013, Doctolib has been improving the daily lives of more than 340,000 healthcare professionals by providing them with new-generation technology and services.  Doctolib also serves more than 70 million patients, offering a fast, frictionless and secure journey for all their care needs.

description: We are looking for a passionate Cloud Engineer, ready to design, build and maintain our workflows and infrastructure with security in mind. Your role Write elegant and expressive code using the latest language features. Keep our services reliable, available, fast, and cost-efficient. Build tools and production frameworks to make our engineering team‚Äôs lives easier. Respond to, investigate, and fix service issues. Design, build and maintain the infrastructure we need to support our data pipelines.

description_entreprise: Qantev is an AI company that helps health insurers deliver better healthcare to their members. They do that by leveraging insurers‚Äô historical health claims data and by applying Machine Learning techniques and Generative AI to predict patient journeys. They are backed by top investors and industry leaders, and have customers all across the world (Europe, USA, LATAM, Asia and the Middle East). They are a growing team of talented, enthusiastic, and diverse professionals. As an early hire, you will have an unparalleled opportunity for ownership and growth within the company.

description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. The Alternative and Credit Team (ACT) is part of the Finance and Investment division which oversees and steers AXA Group investments. Main objective for the team is to define and ensure the proper deployment of AXA Group Investment Plan while maintaining the resilience of AXA Group‚Äôs balance sheet.  Main purpose The intern will gather and analyze financial and economic data to assess investment backdrop and opportunities. The intern will also maintain and improve the existing economic and financial databases and tools and may build new ones.  The intern will report to the Senior Credit Strategist and will work closely with other team members. Core activities   The main tasks for the internship: Gathering and analyzing economic and financial data from various sources (Central Banks, OECD, BIS, Bloomberg, etc‚Ä¶) Building, improving and updating databases and tools  Contributing to the economic and financial memos related to the investment strategy

Chaque jour, ils agissent ensemble pour vous prot√©ger en donnant √† chacun les moyens de vivre une vie meilleure.  Un challenge qui donne le sourire !

description: We are looking for a  Data Analyst Intern  to support our growth and assist Benjamin, co-founder, and the whole team on all our Data topics. You main missions will be: Build, maintain and update our data dashboards stack Derive KPIs from multi-source data to track our business performance Build a reporting pipeline with the strategic team to enable data-driven business decisions Coordinate efforts between the tech and business teams on data related topics Do precise analysis on Business Case and/or on specific metrics (e.g.: analysis of the share of wallet) Understand and prepare product-related improvements through product data Gradually, you may have some missions related to Data Science / Data Engineer: Explore Machine Learning opportunities and implement our first data science-based features Improve and automate our data pipelines along with their monitoring tools Continuously improve our data stack Develop any data projects that can improve the team efficiency This internship is available from  March 2024  for a duration of  6 months .

description: Mission You will be part of the Operations team whose objective is to ensure the proper structuring of the company‚Äôs growth. You will be managed by the  Sales Operations Manager. description: About Stockly Stockly is a retail-tech company that targets to solve the problem of out-of-stock products in e-commerce. With our technology, e-retailers can keep selling out-of-stock products, making other retailers ship them directly to consumers. Our product is live across Europe and convinces more clients every day. Our mission is to create the world first global inventory for retail. To better understand what we do, check out  our French pitch at BFMTV , or  our English pitch at Techstars . We are looking for a smart and talented Data Analyst Intern to join the BI team working closely with our CTO  Oscar , our Head of Network  Pierre , our Financial Officer  Etienne  and our Business Developers (e.g.  Matthieu  &  Yann) . The BI is currently composed of  Maria  and  Anouar . You can apply even if it is to start in 6 months! Position [This is not a Data ‚ÄúScientist‚Äù position, there are no Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence components for now] To tackle our cross team challenges, you are a candidate willing to actively participate to the company development. In our growing team, everyone is key including you as you will be working on the frontier of several domains: Develop and maintain SQL dashboards, to monitor data and analyse performance Extract and interpret data for business requirements Train colleagues on data extraction & interpretation Identify new features to make our product evolve according to usage and needs Everytime you will face recurring tasks or pain points, you will be in charge of finding and implementing solution to tackle this and help the company and team move to next stage. Challenges Tackling an international market in a fast growing startup, you‚Äôll have three main challenges: ‚Ä¢  Complexity : a lot can happen in an e-commerce transaction, specially when you connect multiple players. ‚Ä¢  Performance : Stockly manages tens of millions of articles, that‚Äôs a hell of a lot of web requests per day. ‚Ä¢  Scalability : Being focus on growth, we require that published code still work with ten times more volume. üíù About your future benefits Competitive packages : for this position, package range is typically  1500-2000‚Ç¨  depending on the profile (e.g. basic knowledge to expert). We have a well defined and objective salary grid that is based on both  skills level  and  scarcity of profiles  üí∏ Meal vouchers  by Swile üçΩÔ∏è 50%  reimbursement of your  Navigo Pass  üöã A central and amazing  working environment  in  le Sentier  (Paris) üíº Flexible and  remote-friendly policy  üè° Possibility to take a  few paid days-off  to be discussed with Team Leader üèÑ Stockly dinners  together every other Thursday üçª Stockly breakfasts together  every other Friday ü•ê Coffee, tea and fruits  available everyday üçá Climbing, football & more  teams üßó If your internship goes well for both you and Stockly, why not join us?  We are growing fast, there is space for every amazing people! ‚öôÔ∏è About how we work Every team has a  daily meeting  to align on priorities and solve issues ‚áí  You won‚Äôt be left alone! Every Monday we have a global  weekly meeting  where every team shares what they are working on and what they will do for the coming week ‚áí  You will have visibility on the whole company! Every quarter we have our  OKR meeting  ( Objectives, Key Results)  where each team shows the results of the previous quarter and the objectives of the following one ‚áí  You will see the company grow and your own role inside of it! During all these meetings  everyone can challenge  each other and all questions are more than welcome ‚áí  Transparency is one of our key values, and we are always open to new ideas!

E-retailers can  sell products they don‚Äôt own , while others can gain additional sales, in a  seamless experience for the end-consumer . üèÜ Our mission is to create the  world‚Äôs 1st globally shared inventory  for retail. description: We are looking for a Data Analyst intern to strengthen the R&D department focused on three challenges: Internal Optimization Empower all teams by providing them with clear, reliable, and comprehensive data. Enhance the impact of our sales team by implementing lead scoring to predict which salesperson should handle which lead. Proactively engage with the Customer Success Management (CSM) team by identifying early indicators that may lead to potential customer loss. Gain a deeper understanding of how our customers use our products, including process mining, with the broader goal of personalizing/simplifying the platform based on user profiles. Product Work Conduct statistical analyses of the purchasing behaviors of our end customers to assist them in better understanding their user base. Create a feature based on predicting the cancellation rates of athletes for their classes, allowing them to anticipate with theoretical overbooking. Develop a feature based on predicting the final fill rates of classes to suggest dynamic pricing to studios. Strategic Management Define and implement metrics at different levels, either globally or by team. The bsport data stack comprises a datalake consolidating all available data, a functional data pipeline (Airflow) on AWS infrastructure, and well-integrated visualization tools like Metabase for optimal project launches. The role, directly supervised by the Lead Data, collaborates with various team managers, including the CDO, Head of Sales, Head of CSM, and future COO. Compensation ranges from ‚Ç¨1100 to ‚Ç¨2000 monthly, depending on the profile.

description: At Cardiologs, we aim to democratize access to expert cardiac care through medical-grade artificial intelligence and cloud technology. Our flagship product, the Cardiologs Holter platform, is a leading software for analyzing ambulatory ECG used to help diagnose over 1.8 million patients annually. We are currently venturing into the remote patient monitoring space with the Cardiologs RPM solution, allowing patients to share their smartwatch ECGs with their physicians, who in turn use our cloud-based RPM platform to streamline ECG reviews. In November 2021, we announced that we were being acquired by Philips to expand our cardiac portfolio. We have an innovative, result-oriented work environment where we foster ambition and dedication while being mindful of our teammates‚Äô work and achievements. We also nurture our company culture with monthly all-hands meetings and ap√©ros, and other fun activities.  We are looking for one Fullstack Developer to strengthen our Engineering Team. You will work on our New Businesses (NBX) products according to priorities: RPM, Cardiologs Resting platform, and Biomarkers. Cardiologs Resting platform We are building a new platform that assists physicians in analyzing Resting ECGs and helps them deliver better patient care. You will join a multidisciplinary feature team, composed of Software Engineers, Product Managers, and QA Testers. You will work on a stack based on React and Ruby on Rails, and follow modern web architecture. Your role - As this new product‚Äôs main developer, you will closely relate with the Product Manager to define the most impactful features, ranging from interactive visualization charts to seamless user workflows. - You will also greatly impact the quality of the code base, and ultimately of the product. - You will get to work on a product portfolio used by thousands of physicians and technicians, that already helps them deliver better care to millions of patients annually. What we value We value a positive mindset, collaboration, a sense of ownership, transparency, the ability to embrace ambiguity, a talk-less-do-more attitude, and a sense of humor to enjoy ourselves along the way. If you identify with our values and want to contribute to our company, we‚Äôd love to have you in! What we offer - Beautifully by-the-book startup offices in central Paris (we are in the 2nd arrondissement) - A respectful, fun, collaborative work environment - WFO/WFH policy (2-3 days allowed at home) - Lunch vouchers - Participation and profit-sharing - Access to CE from 6 months of seniority - Remote work allowance

description: In this role, you‚Äôll be mostly working on building algorithms & methods in order to help our users be more successful in their outreach (lemlist). You‚Äôll make sure lempire remains state-of-the-art on machine learning and NLP solutions within the company. This means checking out the latest big language models and coming up with cool new ways to help our software users do more with our tools. You‚Äôll dive right in, quickly making prototypes, improving them bit by bit, testing thoroughly, and getting these smart, GenAI/LLM-powered products out there for people to use By creating more intelligent and user-friendly features, you‚Äôll directly contribute to the success and efficiency of our users‚Äô outreach and communication strategies. You will be part of the Data & Tech team, and you will report to our Lead Data (Eliott). You will play a crucial role in shaping our data strategy and interacting with key functions, including Product and Tech teams. Example of projects: Advanced Data Filtering:  Generate AI-based leads attribute to support the creation of sophisticated filtering and clustering within our Lead Data system, allowing users to target their outreach more precisely. Lead Data Enhancement:  Design algorithms able to precisely associate Leads based on their information (eg First/Last/Company Name with an email or a LinkedIn profile). This will ultimately allow our User to access high-quality prospection data for their outreach. Email Intelligence:  Develop predictive algorithms for email address generation and search, helping users in expanding their contact base with greater accuracy. Email Sequence Optimization:  Analyze user email sequences to develop frameworks that help improve their email outreach effectiveness. Product Development Collaboration:  Work with the Product team to innovate and enhance AI-based features like the Email Sequence Builder and AI Icebreaker generator. This role is not limited to the above. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on other diverse projects for our users - such as AI-Generated Voice Notes, Transcription services, or an in-app Text Editor Assistant - and have the freedom to submit data science proposals. Your first project in the company starts now; please send us a quick cover letter (don‚Äôt do something too formal or complex) where you use the word ‚Äúpineapple‚Äù. Additionally, you may contribute to internal projects like trend analysis and forecasting, always with the aim of driving user success and product innovation. You are the right person if you have an  entrepreneurial spirit & a lot of flexibility.  You‚Äôll have to be comfortable about Understand and meet business and user needs in collaboration with internal teams. Experiment with various methods, balancing resource investment and quality of outcomes. Be proactive in suggesting and scaling up successful solutions. Regularly explore new challenges, focusing on semantic enhancements in line with our main product, lemlist.

description: Overall job definition The focus is on the cell design and the product specification. Main missions and objectives - The cell performance team drives the battery design process on cell level. The design of lithium-ion-batteries allows for many parameters to be set. Each parameter shall be chosen to fulfil the customer requirements to the final product in the best and most cost-efficient way.  The design process starts by analysing the overall product requirements and braking them down to the different cell components. Each design parameter needs then to be verified by testing and simulation, which requires careful planning and execution. The production and the validation of final product must then be accompanied and supported. After completion of the design process, data and results must be aggregated and presented. Final product requirements and specification must be written based in the design process results. -  The main work consists in analysing requirements, working out design proposals and validating the design options. The work includes planning and execution of experiments,  analysing and interpreting results and supporting problem resolution on existing designs. The main outputs of the work are design proposals, validation reports and product specifications. Important secondary outputs are design guidelines and methods, manufacturing process guidelines and problem resolution reports.

description: Our team is actively looking for a Data Scientist Intern for 6 months to apply ML models to our power data time series. You will be in charge of developing a robust automatic incident detection model for wind and solar renewable production.  On your day-to-day, you will:  Process weather and renewable production data Find a way to create a clean database without outliers by developing a robust preprocessing model Develop a defect detection model using supervised and unsupervised data Use neural networks or gradient models Create a benchmarking platform to compare models and improve performances Assess models performances Compare performance between site specific models versus models at portfolio scale Suggest improvements strategies for our predictive models Our Tech Stack:  Backend: Python/Ruby/Rails  Data science: Python,Tensorflow, Numpy Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, InfluxDB Infrastructure: Docker, AWS, Heroku Front-end: Rails, JS (React)

description_entreprise: Streem Energy is the first data hub to help renewable energy players to manage and market their produced electricity , relying heavily on artificial intelligence and data models. Streem provides innovative SaaS solutions for the increasingly distributed power market.  Headquartered in Paris, the company was founded in 2020, and has found immediate success commercializing a first version of its platform among independent power producers in France, Belgium, Spain and Germany, as we continue towards creating a unified European data hub for renewables  Their customers are all along the electricity value chain; ranging from renewable energy producers, power aggregators, energy retailers. The Streem cloud platform communicates in real-time with thousands of renewable energy assets and the team is on a very busy roadmap to push the renewable energy revolution forward!

description: As an intern, you will be a key component of our R&D team building on the latest developments in machine learning to find better solar site and gather strategical information about the field of energy in France and Europe. To find the best solar sites, we need knowledge of all the potential risks (environmental, political, geographical, competition, etc.) a project can face. A lot of this information can be found in documents, tables, databases across the web. Most of it is unstructured. Your primary responsibility will be to design and implement an efficient and multimodal data extraction pipeline that can extract key information from PDF and text documents. We are open to explore and study a wide range of methods, including large language models (LLMs) with retrieval augmented generation (RAG) to reach the best performances. You will also follow the latest trends and applications of machine learning in the industry, with a focus on finding innovative ways to leverage these technologies for solar energy. The intern will receive guidance from a Machine Learning engineer who will oversee the internship, offering scientific and technical support. However, the intern is also encouraged to suggest solutions and operate autonomously. For experiments, we will provide access to APIs, cloud compute with GPUs and all the necessary data. If you are passionate about the energy transition, renewable energy and have a strong background in machine learning and data extraction, we encourage you to apply for this internship opportunity! Why join us ? Would you like to join a GreenTech company with a project that has a strong and direct impact on the energy transition? Would you like to join the core team of an ambitious, fast-growing startup, and actively contribute to its growth and development? üí∞ wage : 1300 euros üéÅ Ticket restaurant card

description_entreprise: AURA AERO, the first digital and eco-efficient aircraft manufacturer, designs and manufactures aircraft with unrivalled efficiency in the booming market of eco-efficient and low carbon emission aircraft. Explore Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) associated with Question Answering based on social media documents.

description: At AXA IM our purpose, to act for human progress by investing for what matters, is central to every action we take as a business. As a future Software and Applications engineer, you will report to Head of Software Development IT, and you will be part of AXA IM Architas. Architas is a dynamic Investment Company, focused on delivering multi-manager investment propositions. Our consistent investment process enables us to design multi-manager solutions as well as act as a centre of investment excellence for the AXA Group. DISCOVER your opportunity  The intern will work closely with the business teams to define new requirements and to provide support on the current features. description: Your role As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, you will be able to: Understand health data and healthcare economy dynamics. Improve our OCR pipeline deployed on insurance claims data. Work on our NLP pipelines for medical coding inference and sentiment analysis on hospital reviews. Enhance our fraud detection machine learning models. Scale our proprietary patient journey optimizer based on state-of-the-art optimal transport. Implement and optimize the associated algorithms. Find and implement the best ways to test and deploy our machine learning models at scale. Continuously provide ideas to improve the solution. Integrate this in our awesome python/pytorch/react/postgresql/elasticsearch stack.

description_entreprise: Qantev is an AI company that helps health insurers deliver better healthcare to their members. They do that by leveraging insurers‚Äô historical health claims data and by applying Machine Learning techniques and Generative AI to predict patient journeys. They are backed by top investors and industry leaders, and have customers all across the world (Europe, USA, LATAM, Asia and the Middle East). They are a growing team of talented, enthusiastic, and diverse professionals. As an early hire, you will have an unparalleled opportunity for ownership and growth within the company.

description: As a member of the operations team, you will: Play a key role in: Automating internal tasks to improve the efficiency of the team. Developing and maintaining reliable and agile interfaces with carriers, customers and several telematic providers. Coordinating integration projects with carrier partners and customers, in particular with their ERP or TMS solutions in relation to their IT department. Have the opportunity to: Design and propose solutions / patches to automate interface processes . Work on a daily basis with the Product Managers, devs, and business teams. Develop, write and maintain technical documents and support materials for the support teams. H** ave the chance to:** Provide technical support in case of incidents Monitor production integrations with KPIs and dashboards Propose processes to constantly increase the quality and speed of interfaces The integrations concern incoming and outgoing flows: transport orders incidents on transport orders GPS positions Your responsibilities will also include: Write scripts to automate internal tasks using python, zapier and other automation tools. Work closely with the rest of the Operations team to execute all carrier onboarding-related activities Lead technical specifications and monitor the delivery of integrations as planned and designed. Monitor the status of the current integrations, specifically carrier and telematics to ensure that everything is working as expected.

Having already raised ‚Ç¨110 million in funding, Shippeo grows on average by 80% year on year. Their team of Shippians comprises 28 different nationalities, speaking a total of 24 languages.

description: üßë‚Äçüíª Our Tech Team They transform complex challenges into elegant solutions! Their ambition is to have a positive impact on the everyday lives of hundreds of millions of consumers around the world by helping them shop smarter. Joko‚Äôs engineers work hand-in-hand with Joko‚Äôs product managers, from exploration, design, and roadmap prioritization to technical specification, implementation, and deployment in production. We have experienced firsthand that teams where engineers have a wide range of skills and where engineering and product collaborate closely ship the best features, offering a truly delightful user experience to our users. Led by Alex, our CTO, they build an incredible experience across all parts of our technical stack, which has many ramifications! üéØ What You Will Do As a  Software Engineer  at Joko, you will develop new features, new products, and improvements in order to bring value to the users of the different Joko products (mobile app, browser extensions, web services, etc.). You will have full ownership of your projects and you will handle their development from A to Z, i.e. from the software design/architecture phase to the deployment in production. The technical challenges that we are trying to solve at Joko are complex and diverse. For example, we are building our own web browser and are processing massive volumes of transactions every day. For this reason, we don‚Äôt want to build a team of specialists, with people who only work on specific tasks (e.g. mobile development, backend development, etc.), but a team of engineers with a wide range of skills that are able to solve complex engineering problems. Your responsibilities: Software design:  You will be responsible for challenging the vision of the Product team, and translating it into a viable architecture on all your projects. Software development:  You will be responsible for the implementation of your software designs from A to Z, across our entire technical stack. Deployment & monitoring in production:  You will be responsible for releasing your projects and monitoring their impact on the users together with the Product team. Research & development:  You will also work on medium-term subjects, such as the real-time analysis of the content of web pages with machine learning algorithms, that will allow Joko to deeply transform the shopping experience of its users tomorrow Training & Recruitment:  You will actively participate in the training of newcomers and in the recruitment process. Tools & processes:  You will help improve the way the Engineering team works by proposing new methods and by developing internal tools.

Joko was created in 2018 by Xavier, Alexandre, and Nicolas and the team has reached great milestones already: 2m+ users 2000+ merchant partners ‚Ç¨12m+ raised from leading European investors 45 team members ‚Ç¨20b transactions processed to date

intitule: Data Center Project Manager, Critical Projects Implementation (CPI)
description: * Please submit a copy of your CV/Resume in English when you are submitting an application. The Critical Projects Implementation (CPI) team is a project management and execution team that manages construction activity within the operational data center spaces. The CPI team is tasked with critical infrastructure improvement projects to optimize utilization of space, power, and cooling within operation data centers around the globe. These activities are outside of the scope of standard construction delivery and regular preventative maintenance tasks. We are currently seeking an energetic Data Center Project Manager to serve as a technical resource within Amazon data centers. You will be part of a highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenges in designing, building, and operating Amazon data facilities. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for project oversight and review of all disciplines including electrical, mechanical, controls, and architectural. A fundamental understanding of these systems is required, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other team and organizations. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to design, develop and deploy innovative solutions to address operational challenges. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams. The scope of projects will include but not limited to the improvement of electrical, mechanical, fire detection and building automation system. The Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. If you are passionate about the Customer Experience; you think big; and you want to contribute to the operational excellence of Amazon data centers then this may be the challenge you‚Äôve been looking for! Key job responsibilities - Project management and oversight of construction related activities as they relate to modifying existing infrastructure for the purpose of installing new or to replace end of life equipment. This will include the ownership of the project scope, timeline, and budget. - Provide project management for specific initiatives aimed at increasing the resiliency of our data centers. - Electrical design and review of designs associated with the optimization of existing data centers. - Construction/project package drawing review. - Creation of project scope, request for proposals, and capital requests. - Total project quality including the creation of a commissioning plan and oversight of the execution. - Recording and reporting key metrics to team members and management. - Operational support including review of procedures, best practices, and maintenance initiatives. - Drive teams to perform troubleshooting and root cause failure analysis associated with equipment or electrical failures. - Work with contractors and vendors to deliver efficient and high quality project turnovers. - Be a leader within the group as well as within internal and external teams that support the data center. A day in the life You will be part of a highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenges in designing, building, and operating Amazon data facilities. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for project oversight and review of all disciplines including electrical, mechanical, controls, and architectural. A fundamental understanding of these systems is required, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other team and organizations. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to design, develop and deploy innovative solutions to address operational challenges. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams. The scope of projects will include but not limited to the improvement of electrical, mechanical, fire detection and building automation system. The Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. If you are passionate about the Customer Experience; you think big; and you want to contribute to the operational excellence of Amazon data centers then this may be the challenge you‚Äôve been looking for! description: Are you interested in working at the business end of Aerospace, where airline brand meets innovative passenger experience? Then your next opportunity could be with Safran Seats, an industry award winning, premium designer and manufacturer of First and Business Class seating and technology. Our passenger experience prides itself on innovation, customisation, quality and industrial design. At Safran Seats, we are unique within aerospace, as we interface with both the world's biggest airlines and airframers alike, with the largest seats portfolio of all seats suppliers. One day you could be liaising with one of the world's largest airframers, and the next, some of the biggest airline brands around the world! In the UK, Safran Seats specialises solely in the First Class and Business Class seating markets for wide body aircraft, with industrial and engineering teams in Cwmbran and Newport, Wales and Brackley, England. We are now recruiting for a Purchasing Data Manager to work as part of our Purchasing team in Cwmbran. This is a brand new role and has been identified to support the business as we continue to grow! The role of Purchasing Data Manager is to work closely with stakeholders across the SGB Purchasing team to lead the daily data management agenda e.g. creation/maintenance of Purchasing KPI's covering Quality, Cost and Delivery metrics. You will work closely with data owners and data stewards to ensure they understand and deliver to their data accountabilities while providing guidance/oversight to all data impacting system changes ensuring consequences are understood across the SGB Purchasing team. The Purchasing Data Manager will be responsible for managing all Engineering Change Requests (ECR's) into the Purchasing Team while working closely with the Engineering team to ensure accurate data is provided in a timely manner as well as establishing a robust process. You will work closely with the Purchasing Methods and Tools (PM&T) specialist to create and develop Purchasing processes. Key Responsibilities & Duties will include; ‚Ä¢   Engineering Change Request (ECR) management for purchased parts ‚Ä¢   Creation/maintenance of Purchasing KPI's (including but not limited to:- Purchase Price Variance (PPV) Purchase Requisitions Invoice management Product sourcing

We partner with airlines, and commercial plane and helicopter manufacturers to bring customers innovative, high added-value solutions to support them in their business. Ces porteurs de projets vont mobiliser des sources de donn√©es tr√®s volumineuses, les croiser entre elles, et utiliser une puissance de calcul pour faire tourner des algorithmes de recherche complexes. Notre offre technologique, en constante √©volution, peut √™tre consult√©e ici. Les d√©fis sont de taille pour traiter ces donn√©es de sant√© sensibles, volumineuses de natures et formats variables. intitule: Machine Learning Engineer Internship - Music Search engine m/f/d
description: In the music streaming industry, search engine is a key component to explore the catalog and discover new content. Users can use the search engine to achieve different goals such as listening to music, adding to favorite or playlist, sharing, fact checking‚Ä¶ Although users use search with a specific idea in mind, they can also use search to explore new content. In this case, we speak of an exploring mindset.  The scientific literature has focused on identifying such mindsets. For instance, if the user types ‚Äúlet it be the beatles‚Äù, we can deduce that the user has a specific idea in mind and wants to click/play/collect the famous song from The Beatles. Whereas queries like "sad rock song from the 80s" or "song for a road trip in Italy" are often associated with non-focused queries. Regarding this last mindset, search engines based on a classical word matching often fails. Indeed, when one searches for "80s rock", one probably doesn't want a track called rock 80, but a track released in the 80s linked with the rock genre.  The objective of this internship will be to study how language models can be used to retrieve the appropriate music content (track, artist, playlist..) to our users, then to apply recent techniques such as  semantic search , generative AI to a production-like environment.  The internship will involve an in-depth literature review of the existing approaches, as well as an analysis of the most relevant strategies to adopt for a music search engine which differs from other search engines. We are open to explore and study a wide range of methods, such as  Retrieval augmented generation (RAG)  and  Query Expansion . The intern will also have the opportunity to implement the selected methods on actual data extracted from Deezer service. The intern will be supervised by one Machine Learning engineer from the search team, who will provide scientific and technical guidance throughout the internship. The intern is nonetheless welcome to propose solutions and work autonomously. For experiments, Deezer ensures access to internal data, cutting-edge technology, and appropriate calculus power. Several previous research interns from our team have tested their algorithms in production, and/or have published results from their work as scientific articles.

intitule: Junior Technical Support Specialist (SaaS)- Big Data & Analytics Fintech
description: What are you going to do? As a Junior Technical Support Specialist for SaaS clients, you will be the bridge between Technical Excellence and Client Satisfaction. Responsibilities: Client-Focused Support: Take ownership of technical issues reported by clients, ensuring timely and effective resolution. Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, delivering exceptional support with a focus on satisfaction. Troubleshooting Mastery: Utilize your expertise in Unix Systems, Bash, and Networks to troubleshoot and diagnose complex technical issues. Identify feasible solutions independently and implement fixes to address client concerns promptly. Collaborative Coordination: Coordinate seamlessly with the product and development teams, acting as a bridge between clients and internal technical resources. Provide detailed and accurate information to assist in the resolution of escalated issues. Proactive Communication: Maintain proactive, reassuring, and transparent communication with clients throughout the support process. Keep clients informed on the status of their reported issues, ensuring a positive client experience. Technical Proficiency: Leverage your technical skills in Terraform, Golang, Docker, Kubernetes, Big Data, Distributed Databases, SQL, Python, and scripting languages. Apply expertise in analyzing and optimizing Tera or Peta scale data processes. End-to-End Support Involvement: Contribute to testing, deployment logics, hardware specifications, and integration processes to ensure robust and reliable SaaS solutions. Participate in on-call duties to address critical issues and maintain continuous service availability. Continuous Improvement: Actively seek opportunities for process improvement, providing valuable insights to enhance the overall support experience. Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to maintain a high level of technical competence. Join Opensee and be a key player in delivering unparalleled technical support for our innovative SaaS solutions. Your skills, commitment, and proactive approach will shape the success of our clients and the evolution of our cutting-edge products.

description: üåü About DinMo DinMo‚Äôs mission is to empower businesses to harness the full potential of their data. Our platform enables users to understand, extract, and channel their data from warehouses and databases directly to their SaaS tools, measuring the resultant impact. What traditionally demanded extensive collaboration between engineering and business teams can now be automated with DinMo, sans a single line of code. This empowers operational teams to concentrate on core business activities. Our team comprises driven engineers from diverse backgrounds, each bringing unique skills to the table, but all united by a shared passion for problem-solving and delivering unparalleled value. We tackle challenges with a first-principle thinking approach, striving for efficient and elegant solutions to stay ahead in this fast-paced market. We‚Äôre on the lookout for team members who are articulate, independent, and driven. üîç Your responsibilities We are actively seeking a seasoned Full Stack Backend Engineer with a profound knowledge of backend systems and a flair for big data. This role is instrumental in refining the systems that underpin DinMo‚Äôs platform, ensuring fluid data synchronization and peak performance. Our tech stack predominantly comprises Typescript, NestJS, and NextJS. Additionally, the role involves configuring SQL queries to data warehouses, securely setting up sync connectors, and working on our chatbot based on LangChain. We‚Äôre not just looking for a coder; we want someone ready to grow with DinMo, introducing innovative concepts and solutions. In this role, you‚Äôll work closely with the CTO and the broader team. Your key responsibilities will include: Spearheading the development and optimization of our backend systems. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to amplify the DinMo platform. Offering technical leadership and guiding junior developers. Pinpointing and resolving potential bottlenecks in scaling and reliability. Keeping abreast of the latest advancements in backend technologies and big data to ensure DinMo‚Äôs technological edge. Enhancing and maintaining our LangChain-based chatbot. This is a golden chance to immerse yourself in a thrilling entrepreneurial venture, exercising autonomy while gaining invaluable mentorship from our seasoned team. Sound enticing? We‚Äôre eager to connect with you!

Our mission is to make data access and use simple and accessible for all companies and employees. We‚Äôve created the first composable CDP that is compliant with data protection laws and accessible to all companies. Using our intuitive interface, analysts, marketers, and sales teams can craft intelligent customer audiences and events without coding. To make all of this actionable, DinMo can synchronise audiences, customer events, and insights with business and activation tools, facilitating the dissemination of knowledge and enabling growth use cases. In just the first year, we‚Äôve assembled a passionate team of 14, launched our product in France, and gained a significant customer base. We have an ambitious product plan and are looking for talented, curious and data-driven people to help us achieve our mission of democratising access to data and becoming European leaders in a booming market.

description: As a member of the Client Data Delivery team, your main responsibilities are to onboard new clients into Square Sense‚Äôs data platform and to ensure the quality of the client data. description: Today we have and maintain two main Products: Jus Connect : a Legal Professional Network to democratize access to visibility and data-driven profiles for legal professionals to empower their professional success. description: De nombreux stages sont √† pourvoir en 2024 Amazon place l‚Äôint√©r√™t du client au premier plan et travaille √† √™tre l‚Äôentreprise la plus orient√©e client au monde. Dans ce cadre, nous recherchons des √©tudiants avec un fort esprit entrepreneurial, soucieux d‚Äôapprendre, mettre en place et lancer de nouveaux projets.  Stage Business Intelligence Engineer 2024 - France Aimez-vous r√©soudre des probl√®mes complexes ? √ätes-vous passionn√© par le d√©veloppement de strat√©gies de test, la recherche et le suivi des bugs jusqu'√† leur r√©solution. L‚Äôattention  que nous portons √† nos clients est la raison pour laquelle nous sommes l‚Äôune des marques les plus appr√©ci√©es au monde : l‚Äôobsession du client fait partie de l‚ÄôADN de notre entreprise. Les ing√©nieurs en business intelligence utilisent une technologie de pointe pour r√©soudre des probl√®mes complexes et constater par eux-m√™mes l‚Äôimpact de leur travail. Les d√©fis que les ing√©nieurs en business intelligence r√©solvent chez Amazon sont importants et affectent des millions de clients, de vendeurs et de produits dans le monde entier.  L'√©quipe des programmes √©tudiants d'Amazon EU recherche des √©tudiants ambitieux pour nous rejoindre en tant que stagiaires au c≈ìur de notre activit√© principale de consommation ! La dur√©e des stages est flexible pour s‚Äôadapter au programme de placement de votre universit√©. We‚Äôre on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you‚Äôre ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth. How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you‚Äôll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow 2024 Business Intelligence Engineer Internship - France Do you enjoy solving complex problems and troubleshooting products? Are you passionate about developing test strategies, finding, and tracking bugs to resolution, and innovating on behalf of customers? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet? At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world‚Äôs most beloved brands ‚Äì customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Business intelligence engineers use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand. The challenges business intelligence engineers solve for at Amazon are big and affect millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. Our path is not always simple, so we are selective about who joins us on this journey. There is a certain kind of person who takes on this role at Amazon ‚Äì someone who is excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years. The Amazon EU Student Programs Team are looking for ambitious students to join us as interns at the heart of our core consumer business! Internships are flexible in length to fit in with your university‚Äôs placement scheme. Key job responsibilities - D√©velopper des solutions analytiques  - Reconna√Ætre et adopter les meilleures pratiques en mati√®re de reporting et d'analyse : int√©grit√© des donn√©es, conception des tests, analyse, validation et documentation - √âcrire du code de haute qualit√© pour r√©cup√©rer et analyser des donn√©es - Concevoir des analyses pragmatiques et des m√©triques automatis√©es qui ajoutent de la valeur √† votre secteur d'activit√© - D√©velopper des analyses (qu'elles soient compl√®tes ou exploratoires) pour le bien de l'entreprise  - Cherchez √† comprendre les objectifs commerciaux pertinents pour votre domaine, - De mani√®re proactive et continue, am√©liorez votre niveau de connaissances sur l'activit√© d'Amazon et les ressources de donn√©es pertinentes - Develop analytical solutions to business problems that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity - Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation - Write high quality code to retrieve and analyze data - Analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context - Design pragmatic analyses and automated metrics that add value to your business area - Understand data resources and how, when, and what to use (and what not to use). - Develop analyses (whether fully formed or exploratory) for the business‚Äô sake, not for analyses‚Äô sake - Seek to understand the business objectives relevant to your area, and align your work to those objectives and seek to deliver business value - Proactively and continually, improve your level of knowledge about Amazon‚Äôs business and relevant data resources A day in the life Nos ing√©nieurs en business intelligence cr√©ent des pipelines de donn√©es, des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des analyses pour fournir des mesures et des informations √† l'entreprise. Nos ing√©nieurs en Business Intelligence rel√®vent certains des d√©fis les plus complexes, travaillent en petites √©quipes au sein de l'entreprise. Dans cette optique, nous demandons aux candidats de d√©montrer leurs comp√©tences techniques dans un certain nombre de domaines. Our Business Intelligence Engineer builds data pipelines, reports, dashboards, and analyses to deliver metrics and insights to the business.  Our Business Intelligence Engineers tackle some of the most complex challenges in large scale computing, work in small teams across the company to contribute to the e-commerce platform that's used by millions of people all over the world. With that in mind, we require applicants to demonstrate their technical skills in a number of areas. About the team Si vous √™tes insatiablement curieux et souhaitez toujours en savoir plus, alors vous √™tes au bon endroit. En fonction de votre emplacement, de votre pays, de votre statut professionnel et d'autres exigences, tout ou partie des avantages suivants peuvent vous √™tre offerts en tant que stagiaire. - Salaire comp√©titif - Projets percutants  - Travail hybride (en fonction de l'√©quipe) - Opportunit√©s de networking avec d'autres stagiaires - √âv√©nements de stages tels que des conf√©rences - Mentorat et d√©veloppement de carri√®re Si vous r√©ussissez votre stage, vous pourriez √™tre consid√©r√© pour un poste apr√®s l'obtention de votre diplome.  Les dates de d√©but des stages varient tout au long de l‚Äôann√©e. La dur√©e du stage est id√©alement de 6 mois. If you‚Äôre insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you‚Äôve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern. - Competitive pay - Impactful project and internship/role deliverables - Hybrid working (team dependent) - Networking opportunities with fellow interns  - Internships events such as speaker series, intern panels, Leadership Principles sessions, Amazon writing skills sessions. - Mentorship and career development If you‚Äôre successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies. Internship start dates vary throughout the year. Internship length is ideally 6 months.     We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Clichy, FRA

description_entreprise: Amazon est l‚Äôentreprise la plus orient√©e client au monde et est guid√©e par quatre principes :  l‚Äôobsession client plut√¥t que l‚Äôattention port√©e √† la concurrence,  la passion pour l‚Äôinvention,  l‚Äôengagement en faveur de l‚Äôexcellence op√©rationnelle, la r√©flexion √† long terme. description: Are you interested in working at the business end of Aerospace, where airline brand meets innovative passenger experience? Then your next opportunity could be with Safran Seats, an industry award winning, premium designer and manufacturer of First and Business Class seating and technology. Our passenger experience prides itself on innovation, customisation, quality and industrial design. At Safran Seats, we are unique within aerospace, as we interface with both the world's biggest airlines and airframers alike, with the largest seats portfolio of all seats suppliers. One day you could be liaising with one of the world's largest airframers, and the next, some of the biggest airline brands around the world! In the UK, Safran Seats specialises solely in the First Class and Business Class seating markets for wide body aircraft, with industrial and engineering teams in Cwmbran and Newport, Wales and Brackley, England. The role of Manufacturing Engineer involves supporting all assembly operations on day to day activities. You will liaise with design and SQA Industrialisation departments to deliver customer programs on time and to a high quality standard.  Key Responsibilities & Duties include; ‚Ä¢ Provide Engineering Support to the Assembly lines ‚Ä¢ Design new systems, equipment and processes for the introduction of new products or the improvement of existing ones ‚Ä¢  Facilitate Problem solving activities ‚Ä¢ Eliminating non-value adding activities ‚Ä¢   Maintain Bill of Materials within the ERP system ‚Ä¢  Review engineering drawings and process ECR's ‚Ä¢ Manage operations Configuration tracker  ‚Ä¢  Support production readiness reviews ‚Ä¢  Assist with ergonomic workshops ‚Ä¢   Raising necessary documentation to incorporate change.  ‚Ä¢   Support Operations departments with Operator training and development ‚Ä¢ Implement 5S and safety standards ‚Ä¢ Keep up to date with current and developing trends in the manufacturing industry ‚Ä¢  Undertake other reasonable duties, in line with business needs and objectives. The hours of work for this role are; Monday - Thursday; 7.30am-4.00pm Friday; 7.30am-1.00pm

description: * Please submit a copy of your CV/Resume in English when you are submitting an application. The Critical Projects Implementation (CPI) team is a project management and execution team that manages construction activity within the operational data center spaces. The CPI team is tasked with critical infrastructure improvement projects to optimize utilization of space, power, and cooling within operation data centers around the globe. These activities are outside of the scope of standard construction delivery and regular preventative maintenance tasks. We are currently seeking an energetic Data Center Project Manager to serve as a technical resource within Amazon data centers. You will be part of a highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenges in designing, building, and operating Amazon data facilities. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for project oversight and review of all disciplines including electrical, mechanical, controls, and architectural. A fundamental understanding of these systems is required, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other team and organizations. Ideal candidates will possess the ability to design, develop and deploy innovative solutions to address operational challenges. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams. The scope of projects will include but not limited to the improvement of electrical, mechanical, fire detection and building automation system. The Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. If you are passionate about the Customer Experience; you think big; and you want to contribute to the operational excellence of Amazon data centers then this may be the challenge you‚Äôve been looking for! Key job responsibilities - Project management and oversight of construction related activities as they relate to modifying existing infrastructure for the purpose of installing new or to replace end of life equipment. This will include the ownership of the project scope, timeline, and budget. - Provide project management for specific initiatives aimed at increasing the resiliency of our data centers. - Electrical design and review of designs associated with the optimization of existing data centers. - Construction/project package drawing review. - Creation of project scope, request for proposals, and capital requests. - Total project quality including the creation of a commissioning plan and oversight of the execution. - Recording and reporting key metrics to team members and management. - Operational support including review of procedures, best practices, and maintenance initiatives. - Drive teams to perform troubleshooting and root cause failure analysis associated with equipment or electrical failures. - Work with contractors and vendors to deliver efficient and high quality project turnovers. - Be a leader within the group as well as within internal and external teams that support the data center. A day in the life You will be part of a highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenges in designing, building, and operating Amazon data facilities. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for project oversight and review of all disciplines including electrical, mechanical, controls, and architectural. A fundamental understanding of these systems is required, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other team and organizations. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams. The scope of projects will include but not limited to the improvement of electrical, mechanical, fire detection and building automation system. The Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. description: As a Software Engineer intern, you will be a valuable member of our Tech team, designing and developing innovative features for our solar site analysis algorithm. To find the best solar sites, we need to possess a thorough understanding of environmental, political, geographical, and competitive factors that may impact solar site development. It implies having a deep understanding of the market and having expertise in handling large datasets to extract valuable insights for solar site selection. Your primary responsibility will be to work on our product to identify potential solar sites using geographical data. Your will focus on designing and implementing efficient data ingestion pipelines to integrate diverse geographical data sources (identification, ingestion and processing) and enhance our core algorithms for filtering and analysing geographical data to identify optimal solar sites. You will also confront complex performance optimization challenges, including SQL query optimization, multithreaded/distributed programming, and database cost optimization. As an intern, you will be fully integrated into our Tech team, receiving mentorship from a experienced Software Engineer and collaborating with colleagues. You will be provided with technical guidance and a deeper understanding of the solar energy market. However, you will also be encouraged to propose solutions and operate autonomously. You will also closely collaborate with our project and sales teams to develop features that align with the solar market‚Äôs needs. If you are passionate about the energy transition, want to contribute to the future of France and Europe‚Äôs solar market, and have a strong Software Engineering background, we encourage you to apply for this internship opportunity! Why join us ? Would you like to join a GreenTech company with a project that has a strong and direct impact on the energy transition? Would you like to join the core team of an ambitious, fast-growing startup, and play a direct part in its development and structuring? üí∞ Wage : 1300 euros üéÅ Ticket restaurant card

description: In the Engineering department,  we‚Äôre using Deep Learning, including generative AI methods, to improve 3D animation production , focusing on retargeting, motion retrieval, motion style transfer, and text-based motion generation. Our work involves 3D stylized characters, exploring different representation methods like skeleton definitions and 3D triangular meshes. Skeleton-based methods are good for retargeting but struggle with custom characters in production due to varying skeleton structures. The 3D mesh method, which uses faces and vertices, offers more flexibility but  requires high memory and computational resources , limiting its use in dynamic and interactive scenarios. The internship aims to  review current mesh representation literature  and  develop a 3D mesh auto-encoder  to efficiently capture object shapes and compress them into a latent representation. This could reduce computational demands, allowing for more complex motion models and interactions between multiple characters.
