description: Intersec is an international  software vendor , founded in Paris in 2004, it offers  GeoData  solutions to  Mobile Telecom  Operators and public organizations. We are about 160 employees around the world, and we achieve a turnover of 20M‚Ç¨ in 2022.Intersec is  developing software  to deliver  high volume data at speed for the telecoms sector  and carving a space developing  location technology  for mobile operators. Our solutions were built from the ground up using fast data and AI.Today, our 100+ clients in 80 countries trust us to access to the location of nearly one billion humans and connected objects.They require a combination of speed and location accuracy, alongside an understanding of their unique implementation challenges.Our industry-focused products enable them to turn  GeoData  into actionable insights in the fields of  public safety,  contextual marketing,  geolocated advertising , smart cities, and the management of connected object fleets (IoTs). As a  Python Developer  you will i mplement  new customer specific features on top of the main Intersec products,  maintain them, continuously improve the code base Responsibilities:  You are  involved in all the phases of the implementation  of a feature : The technical design  of the feature based on its functional description defining the architecture of the solution  The implementation  by writing an elegant and efficient code based on the Python SDK provided by the main Intersec products to make the feature happen Reviewing the code  of your fellow developers so everybody can improve the quality of the code base Make sure the performances are the best they can with regular benchmarks Maintain and rework the part that can be done better  Requirements Our technical environnement: Code base:   Homemade low level SDK in python : all data structures, database connections, Webservices interfaces, etc are automatically generated and part of the framework. Test framework:  Python behave and unit tests Version Control System:   Git Environnement:  Linux (Debain or any distro you use) IDE :  Mostlyy Vim or Emacs We are looking for someone who has : Good knowledge of theory in  Algorithms & Data structures. Good knowledge of  Python Bonus if you have skills in  Git or Linux Benefits Why join Intersec: You can build fully functional feature from A to Z You tackle  challenging  and interesting programming problems with real usages such as :  Scalability issues:  how our solutions can handle 10 times more events per second? how can we store the data of an operator with 50 million of subscribers? Versatility:  our customers have very different infrastructures, subscribers behavior and thus needs, so how do you make a product that can address a wide range of possibilities? Everything is homemade so you can get to the bottom of things in the code, there is no black box You get to improve your technical knowledge and your skills every day, by tackling new problems and working with skillful people If you are looking for a team open to innovation and initiative, friendly and competent colleagues. If you like multicultural environments (+25 nationalities). If you are looking for an environment with a strong technological culture: blog, hackathon, show & tell, best practices / standby. We value agility, team spirit, innovation, benevolence, Several ‚ÄúWell-being‚Äù and ‚Äúteam building‚Äù activities, Swile card for the lunch break, 100% coverage of the Navigo subscription, competitive healthcare insurance, remote friendly (3 days per week), and many other benefits. Support for people with disabilities and annual offer of CESU vouchers with a face value of 1000 ‚Ç¨ to our employees with the Recognition as Disabled Workers.        Ready for the challenge? Let us know more about you!

description: Mirakl is the global leader in platform business innovation. Mirakl's suite of solutions provides enterprises with a transformative way to drive significant growth and efficiency in their online business. Since 2012, Mirakl has been pioneering the platform economy, empowering retail and b2b enterprises with the most advanced, secure and scalable technology to digitize and expand product assortment through marketplace and dropship, improve efficiency in supplier catalog management and payments, personalize shopping experiences, and boost profits through retail media. Mirakl is trusted by 400+ industry-leading businesses worldwide including Macy‚Äôs, Decathlon, Kroger, Airbus, Toyota Material Handling and Sonepar. Headquartered in Paris and Boston and with offices in 7 countries, Mirakl is recognized as a Great Place to Work company. We are looking for a high-energy, creative, team-oriented Business Solution Architect with a business and IT background to help our Finance, Legal and HR teams achieve a new level of performance. In this role, you will focus on designing and implementing comprehensive IT solutions across those departments. You will have responsibility and autonomy to bridge the gap between business requirements and technology solutions, ensuring that the processes are aligned with Mirakl's strategic objectives. Your dual expertise in business and technology will lead you in collaborating closely with Finance, Legal and HR teams to drive innovation, improve operations within the company, and reinforce Mirakl‚Äôs long-term position as the category leader. In your role, you will be supported by a highly experienced management team and have the resources to invest in your business. Your role at Mirakl:  Collaborate with finance, legal, HR departments to understand their specific needs, challenges and objectives. Document and analyze processes, workflows, and data requirements. Develop holistic financial system architecture with detailed design specifications, including data models, workflows, and integration points. Continuously assess the suitability of existing systems (Netsuite, Ironclad, Bamboo, etc.) for Mirakl‚Äôs needs. Research and recommend improvements of existing solutions or new ones that can enhance financial, legal and HR operations. Define and design integration solutions for Mirakl financial systems with other companies‚Äô systems (e.g, ERP, CRM, HRM). Collaborate with IT teams and vendors to implement or improve those systems. Ensure that they meet business requirements. Oversee system configuration, customization, and testing. Develop data governance policies and procedures to maintain data quality, security, and compliance. Ensure that financial systems comply with industry regulations and accounting standards. Generate reports and dashboards to support decision-making. Manage relationships with third party vendors and service providers, including contract negotiations and performance monitoring. What Mirakl is looking for in a candidate: Several years of experience in finance, accounting, or a related field + at least one experience with financial systems and technology.  A prior experience in a financial consulting or solution architect role. Proficiency in financial software and tools, such as ERP systems or Billing tools (e.g., Netsuite, SAP, Oracle), financial modeling software, and financial analytics tools. Excellent communication and relationship building skills In-depth knowledge of financial management principles, accounting standards and financial reporting. Ability to analyze financial statements. Expertise in designing and architecting financial solutions, and in creating comprehensive system architecture and integration plans. Experience in designing and leading projects and programs through to completion Fluent in English   We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you‚Äôre ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you‚Äôre not an exact match.

description: About us Airbus pioneers sustainable aerospace for a safe and united world. The Company constantly innovates to provide efficient and technologically-advanced solutions in aerospace, defence, and connected services. In commercial aircraft, Airbus offers modern and fuel-efficient airliners and associated services. Airbus is also a European leader in defence and security and one of the world‚Äôs leading space businesses. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions and services worldwide. Job description Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a  Material & Processes Interface Manager (f/m)  to join our team based in Toulouse, France. You will be part of a team responsible for the Research, the development, the Technical qualification, the support to Manufacturing Plants and to In service Aircrafts for the critical products and processes (Metallic & Composite Rods, Bearings, Plastic and metallic mechanical systems supports) for all Airbus aircraft. This organization is also The Airbus Center of Excellence for Wear & Fretting activities.   Materials & Processes, Assembly Technology Engineering has the technical accountability for Research, Development, Qualification and harmonization of Products for Structure. It delivers Materials & Processes inputs into Definition Dossier in terms of Assembly product assessments, replacement strategies, life cycle assessment, and technical expertise. Processes & Tests organization is an in-house Department The scope of activities also extends to other Airbus divisions and partners in some cases.   Within the Assembly Structural Hardware Systems Team, you will be in charge to define and find the technical solutions for products (Rods, Bearings, Brackets) for our installed products, to consolidate the conformity of products versus requirements. Your working environment: Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities!  How we care for you: ‚óè Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis.  ‚óè Work / Life Balance: Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services. ‚óè Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application.  ‚óè Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility.  At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking. Your challenges: Contributing to the creation and to the development of Structural Hardware Systems In Engineering  Performing the technical support, Research & Technology, Development and Technical qualification, Contributing to Aircraft certification, Supporting Manufacturing Engineering, Plants and Customer Service, Providing Technical Support for Quality issues.  Consolidating conformity of equipment versus requirements Participating in the development of SHS equipment Answering the schedule requirements, budget and quality development Contributing to innovative ideas inputs and to the continuous improvement of service This role will involve some travel for business and as such, you must be able to travel accordingly. You will interface with a lot of stakeholders: Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Programs, Procurement, Quality Supply Chain, Suppliers, .. Your boarding pass: Master degree (or equivalent) in Engineering specialized in Materials & Processes, Mechanics and/or Surface Technologies You have an experience in Material characterization An experience in Project management is appreciated You have an innovative mindset and creativity Ability to work with a good team spirit, a good relationship You have a negotiation level in French and English Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.  Take your career to a new level and apply online now! description: What we do At Doctolib we build products that need to scale to millions of people throughout Europe and to yet remain easily maintainable by hundreds of developers. The backend runs on Ruby on Rails, backed by PostgreSQL and Redis. Front side, we bet on React, even for our mobile apps. We do several daily deployments, and run 25K+ automated tests through our CI pipeline. Our PostgreSQL managed databases represent a total of  30TB and receive 30M queries by minute under high traffic. We are seeking a talented and motivated Database Reliability Engineer to join our team and play a critical role in preserving the performance of our databases. Your missions As a Database Administrator on our Doctolib Database Optimization team, you will be at the forefront of maintaining the health and performance of our databases. You will: Build and support strategies to help the modularization of our main PostgreSQL database into a distributed and scalable ecosystem of smaller databases. Monitor query performance, review data models, data access patterns, offering insights and recommendations to feature teams for optimization and guidance in selecting appropriate data stores for their use cases. Perform maintenance related tasks on our managed databases to enhance stability and improve performances Develop and evangelize database best practices. Create documentation and training materials to empower feature teams to make informed decisions regarding data storage and access. Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify performance bottlenecks, latency issues, and potential system failures at the database level. Your skills You could be our next team mate if you: Have 8+ years of experience as a Database Administrator with a focus on reliability and scalability. Have strong problem -solving skills, especially in identifying and rectifying database performance bottlenecks. Have excellent communication skills, enabling efficient transmission of knowledge. Have experience in mentoring junior engineers on database performance challenges (queries optimization and best practices) Are eager to leverage your experience and skills to make your team and the whole Tech team grow. Speak English. Now, it would be fantastic if you also: Have been involved in Architecture choices for high traffic web applications, particularly scalability challenges on large databases. Have experience with cloud -based environments and databases such as AWS Aurora PostgreSQL.  Have experience with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB. Have experience with Change Data Capture ecosystems & technologies such as Kafka and Debezium. The interview process  45 min phone screen with a Tech Recruiter 1h30 Database Reliability Engineer interview 1h15 Methodology interview Half day immersion

intitule: Intern (April 2024 - 6 months) in Reinsurance Reserving Actuarial Team - (M/F)
description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. Within the Group,  you will join the Group Ceded Re department  which oversees AXA Group  Reinsurance . Within this Department, you will be part of the Reinsurance Reserving team that is responsible of technical reserve calculation for a portfolio of major life and non-life risks from AXA Group entities. Reserving enables to anticipate and cover future claims arising from reinsurance treaties underwritten by AXA SA. Technical reserves must be estimated as accurately as possible based on information on claims, and in particular their development between various phases: occurrence, declaration, payments, and closure.   About Reserving Team: the team is composed of 5 actuaries of Institut des Actuaires with 2 to 10 years of experience and of different cultures.  Job purpose This internship is an opportunity to apply and improve your knowledge of statistics, modeling, data analysis, reinsurance and reserving. With the help of the internship tutor, the intern will implement new models and tools to enable the AXA Group's reinsurance to be properly modeled and monitored.  Dimension, context & challenges Context : One aspect of Reinsurance is a high volatility of covered risks and low frequency of incurred claims. In that context, it is important to be able to identify the different risks and uncertainties that the company could face. This can be done through different risk scenarios (e.g. new claims or development of known claims‚Ä¶). Challenges : The aim is to use the most granular claims database available to bring some new analyses and understandings, and eventually to  build risks scenarios . Especially, you will use the individual claims information in a reinsurance context. You will help the team to better understand the data and to better communicate actuarial reserves through meaningful risk scenarios.  Key accountabilities The key analysis to be produced: Construction of a model which, based on claims data, will be able to produce analyses of frequency and severity, calculation of development patterns and generate scenarios for the development of reserves; Allocate the reserves assessed by the reserving team into reinsurance risk scenarios (IBNeR and IBNyR scenarios). Finally, you can be asked to deploy into the reserving team R shiny app your model for a better visualization.

description: Our business, protection. We protect people, property and assets.  Our purpose, Act for Human Progress by protecting what matters. Does this speak to you? Then come and join 149,000 future colleagues who are committed to our 95 million clients in 50 countries around the world every day. Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. AXA is built around diversity and unity, which is why we are committed to promoting collective success through inclusion. Within the Group,  you will join the AXA Emerging Customers department . AXA‚Äôs Emerging Customer team leads AXA‚Äôs inclusive insurance strategy, which aims at protecting mass market and low-to-middle income segments across countries. The objective of our business is to protect vulnerable customers who are ill-insured and help them cope at time of financial distress. As an illustration, we develop small ticket insurance for small business owners, independent workers, farmers, migrant workers, etc.   This initiative is a defined business unit with commercial objectives as well as a social impact mission. More concretely, the Emerging Customers team supports AXA subsidiaries in countries to roll out their Emerging Customers‚Äô business through partnership-building, customer research, product development, design of customer journey, optimization of operations & IT, and impact assessment. The KPIs of our distribution partners and the priorities & needs of our end clients are central to the team: the objective is to anticipate changing social & economic needs to tailor our products and services accordingly. Clients-centricity is not just a buzz word: we apply human-centered design methodologies on the ground to tailor new products and services to customer needs leverage technology. We meet these needs by developing innovative solutions that leverage cutting-edge yet often simple technologies. Primary mission AXA Emerging Customers team is looking for a reporting analyst / developer with strong statistics skills and interest in the financial inclusion space willing to perform a 6 month internship. The primary mission will be to help the team improve the efficiency of performance tracking tools by designing, developing, testing, and supporting business intelligence and analytics solutions. The candidate will work closely with stakeholders to enhance and optimize user-friendly reports and dashboards, aligned with the desired requirements in data analytics projects and digital marketing campaigns across 14 countries.  Main activities Business reporting tools and data analytics projects Maintains, adapts, and enhances business dashboards and analytics tools under the guidance of the Data and analytics manager. Understands multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions. Ensures that all data is operationally accurate and appropriate throughout data management processes, including internal and external data collection, data transformation, data quality. Applies data visualization methodologies - often selecting the right data ‚Äòtool for the job‚Äô - to identify and improve business procedures and practices. Develops and delivers management dashboards and canned reports to support management oversight of business performance. Support actuaries and data analysts in ongoing projects.   Performance analysis and in-depth descriptive analytics on emerging customers projects: Performs in-depth descriptive analysis throughout the customer lifecycle of live programs, to provide data-driven insights that help improve business value and new business development. Uses data modelling techniques to identify ways in which a program can operate more effectively. Evaluates end-to-end digital customer experience to optimize and improve the reach and engagement of multiple digital marketing campaigns. Provides feedback on technology enhancements that could improve analytic tracking.

description: Today we have and maintain two main Products: Jus Connect : a Legal Professional Network to democratize access to visibility and data-driven profiles for legal professionals to empower their professional success. The legal industry is being revolutionised by LLMs. Lawyers are eagerly adopting cutting-edge technologies, and we are riding this wave! The moment is now. We mainly follow a Kanban/Lean paradigm cherry-picking Events or Artefacts from other methods to create our own practice, matching our own organization. We have an Engineering Culture. Big Ideas, Pragmatical Implementation.

description: Following an internal job transfer, we are looking for a new Potato Technical Operations CE Manager for our Continental Europe plants. In the position of CE Technical Operations Potato Manager, you execute the CE Tech Ops strategy to drive and sustain manufacturing optimization (Safety, Quality, Cost), support Growth and Transform Operations to be future ready, while managing a team to develop technical expertise and leadership. As CE Technical Operations Potato Manager, you will chair the Potato team of Tech Ops and report to the Potato & Appetizer Technical Operations CE Director. This position is based in Harnes, one of our French production plant located in the heart of the Nord Pas-de-Calais mining basin, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site. Established since 1981, the Harnes site is accessible by car, bicycle, or bus (nearest bus stop: Route de Lille).   Most important responsibilities: Team Management & Technical Expertise Development: ‚Ä¢ Lead and develop a high-performing technical operations team, drive a culture of continuous improvement in technical skills and operational efficiency. ‚Ä¢ Deploy technical training document (with MDI) to develop manufacturing capabilities. Execution of Strategy and Priorities: ‚Ä¢ Implement and execute the strategic direction and ensure alignment of team goals, prioritize and oversee the execution of key projects. ‚Ä¢ Implement new technologies and scale up to simplify plant in collaboration with global Tech Ops Project Management: ‚Ä¢ Manage the regional execution of technical projects in coordination with cross-functional teams (Manufacturing, Engineering, R&D Innovation) according to the Tech Ops role and accountability. ‚Ä¢ Monitor project timelines, budgets, and deliverables to achieve successful outcomes. Problem Solving and Continuous Improvement: ‚Ä¢ Partner closely with all technical teams to define, track and address operational issues and needs with a positive impact on safety, product quality, cost, efficiency. ‚Ä¢ Proactively identify solutions to improve manufacturing performance and costs without compromising quality and safety. Best Practices Adherence: ‚Ä¢ Ensure strict adherence and sustain standards for operational excellence. ‚Ä¢ Provide guidance and ensure evaluation of McCain Operations Standards within plants.

description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. Description As part of the new Solvency II regulation, AXA has developed its own internal model for the calculation of the economic capital. The GRM Life team is responsible for the developments related to the Life risks (Mortality, Pandemic, Lapse, Mass Lapse, Disability etc.) and works continuously on the model‚Äôs improvements and on the quantification of these risks. One of the main challenges faced by insurers is the risk of a deviation of policyholders lapse behavior: lapse up and lapse down risks refer to the risks that customers surrender their insurance policies respectively more or less than expected. The mass lapse risk sub-module captures the risk of a temporary but sudden significant increase in lapses. This risk encompasses lapses due to a fear of bankruptcy or a reputation issue.  GRM offers an internship position dedicated to the lapse and mass lapse models. This model review and improvement is eagerly awaited in the aftermath of the recent interest rates surge that brought lapse and mass lapse to the first position in terms of life risks. Thus, it is a great opportunity to develop a strong expertise and knowledge on this important topical issue. Main tasks The main mission will be to review and improve the lapse and mass lapse models. The outputs of the enhanced models will be the inputs of the next economic capital assessment. This mission will encompass an exhaustive review and analysis of the existing models and data. For the mass lapse model, the intern is expected to analysis the past mass lapse events using internal and external data then to challenge the current frequency/severity model and finally to propose enhancements to address its limitations.  For both models, the impact of the changes will need to be quantified and a clear synthesis of the work with re-usable tools and appropriates reports/presentations should be provided.   Of course, as you will be fully integrated to the team, you will also have the possibility to contribute to other projects and tasks that are part of our day-to-day work as international risk managers.

description: At Amazon, our vision is to be earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. description: Are you interested in working at the business end of Aerospace, where airline brand meets innovative passenger experience? Then your next opportunity could be with Safran Seats, an industry award winning, premium designer and manufacturer of First and Business Class seating and technology. Our passenger experience prides itself on innovation, customisation, quality and industrial design. At Safran Seats, we are unique within aerospace, as we interface with both the world's biggest airlines and airframers alike, with the largest seats portfolio of all seats suppliers. One day you could be liaising with one of the world's largest airframers, and the next, some of the biggest airline brands around the world! In the UK, Safran Seats specialises solely in the First Class and Business Class seating markets for wide body aircraft, with industrial and engineering teams in Cwmbran and Newport, Wales and Brackley, England. We are now recruiting for a Technical Author to join the existing team in Newport. In this role you will be responsible for the creation and maintaining of all technical publications related to Safran Seats GB products. Reporting to the Lead Technical Author, you will work with the rest of the team to produce and revise documentation, in line with business and customer schedules. What makes being a Technical Author at Safran special is the variety and scope of the work you will see. From the very first flight of a Safran product, maintenance instructions must be available to the customer. As the product matures, design improvements can be made available to the customer, via the technical documentation we provide. Working within the Aftermarket team, we have the benefit of supporting a product throughout its whole life cycle, from first flight, to last. Key responsibilities and duties include: ‚Ä¢  Writing and illustrating: o Component Maintenance Manuals (CMMs) o  Service Bulletins (SBs) o   Service Information Letters (SILs) o    Installation Documents ‚Ä¢    Investigate and respond to queries from both internal and external stakeholders ‚Ä¢   Work closely with the aftermarket engineering team to devise and communicate a solution to the customer in a timely manner.

description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.  Your work environment The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA)  brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work. Context AXA Group Risk Management Property & Casualty (GRM P&C) deals with the most sophisticated P&C technical and actuarial challenges of a leading international insurance company, among which the management of natural catastrophe risks (CAT). Natural variability of climate and seismic activity have demonstrated their devastating potential, climate change bringing additional uncertainty for the future. AXA‚Äôs rapid expansion over the last years ‚Äì both in terms of geographical footprint and P&C insurance offer ‚Äì widely exposes AXA to natural perils, being in charge of the financial protection of its clients. In this context, AXA must maintain state-of-the-art CAT risk management techniques through permanent innovations. AXA GRM brings together high level and multidisciplinary staff with engineers, PhDs, actuaries, data scientists and financials split between Paris, Hong Kong, Z√ºrich and Madrid. Its main missions are focused on the following key areas: develop and maintain models and tools in an efficient and strong IT ecosystem to industrialise deliverables; analyse, model and aggregate the Group‚Äôs risks (economic capital); define and implement the process enabling to secure the undertaken risks (risk appetite, assets accumulation, longevity, natural catastrophe ...); optimize the Group protections (reinsurance, securitization, hedging, etc.) to meet the desired strategy. Job Summary Position belongs to the Group Risk Management P&C CAT and Reinsurance team (21 FTE) which is organized in several excellence centers: CAT R&D Modeling, Data Analytics, Accumulation Management and Reinsurance. As part of AXA‚Äôs Internal Model under the Solvency II framework, the CAT and Reinsurance teams are primarily in charge of delivering the annual CAT modeling process, consisting of: Collecting CAT exposure data (geographical, physical and financial information) on a per-entity (AXA France, AXA Mexico, AXA Philippines‚Ä¶) and per-location basis (houses, factories, vehicles etc.); Assessing the risk on a per-entity per-peril basis  (cyclones, earthquakes, floods, hailstorms...) which feeds the whole downstream chain locally (pricing, budgets, reinsurance decisions, capital modeling); Estimating the efficiency of the Group Reinsurance covers; Developing in-house models, methodologies and applications to support the CAT risk monitoring. The CAT modelling process has strong strategic and operational impacts since it feeds AXA Economic Capital internal model, the Economic Combined Ratio and NAT CAT budget calculations which drives the earnings and the solvency position of AXA Group. It and determines adequate levels of reinsurance needs, which may boost or hinder profitability. It is also a technical challenge with the data collection of 25+ millions of complex and worldwide policies covering 50+ millions risks, the parallel use of multiple modeling solutions including both physics and machine learning techniques, and finally the assessment of almost 190 country x peril levels of risk. Going beyond the use of external solutions, AXA Group develops its own suite of CAT models. The models are nested in a global and robust workflow, largely automated and auditable. In addition, leveraging this Group knowledge and expertise for the business, the team has been developing actuarial frameworks and powerful GIS solutions to diffuse CAT model result data, provide CAT technical pricings, alert and assess live event impacts across the world. The CAT Quality control & Governance officer will play a strong role to ensure the quality, control and validation of the products with a strong transversal connection between the operational teams, diverse Group functions (IT departments, Enterprise Risk Management, ‚Ä¶), AXA entities and regulators. The CAT Quality control & Governance officer  will have to  revamp the CAT governance involving AXA entity expertise to evaluate and validate the models which feed the AXA internal model, implement innovative tests and controls to ensure the accuracy and traceability of data,  be proactive and innovative in the continuous development of new functionalities, best-practices, and the systematic look for efficiency gains. Position Responsibilities Implement innovative tests and controls to verify, evaluate and validate the models Lead and implement best-practices and methodologies to test, evaluate and validate CAT models. Leverage data analytics, CAT developer and IT expertise to design analysis and automatic tests of sophisticated models with a large volume of data. Revamp  the CAT governance with the involvement of both Group and entity expertise. Participate in the building of a powerful and efficient IT ecosystem. Interpretation and effective communication of technical analysis. Support the audit reviews and regulator requests. Evolve in the regulation environment (Solvency II, GDPR): produce technical documentation, adopt best knowledge management practices and make sure governance standards and Group recommendations are followed at Group and entity levels.   Assess CAT risks borne by AXA operational entities (CAT Process) Provide a technical support to local entities around the collection of their P&C exposure data. Assess CAT risks (cyclones, earthquakes, floods, hailstorms) associated to these exposures using dedicated catastrophe modelling tools. Deliver an AXA view of the gross risk for several entities enabling them to purchase adequate reinsurance in line with their risk appetite. Infuse, diffuse and leverage CAT expertise Support the P&C risk assessment related to CAT risks (Live Event Analysis, Parametric insurance, Real Disaster Scenarios). Support business development and profitability within AXA P&C entities by diffusing operational solutions consistent with the most up-to-date scientific assessment of the hazard and risk. Participate in the Group‚Äôs response to climate risks and their evolutions, within its corporate responsibility framework.

description: As a Customer Success Manager you goal is to secure the adoption of our payment platform. Your main objective is to ensure a smooth onboarding experience and to maximise the benefits the customers get from the Expensya platform as well as the volumes of spend on the platform. Your missions Understand the customers‚Äô objectives and expectations from the Expensya payment product Manage the whole customer journey from onboarding to the full usage of the platform Provide guidance and best practices to the customers on the most effective implementation of the platform and future usage of the cards. Assist the customer during the change management process both for financial teams and the end-users to ensure a rapid and comprehensive usage of the cards. description_entreprise: Combining the expertise of a leader with the agile culture of a startup, Expensya continues to excel in keeping with our core values: relentless pursuit of excellence, accountability, innovation, winning as a team, and customer focus. Founded in 2014 by Karim Jouini and Jihed Othmani (former Microsoft), and joined in 2015 by Marc Clatot (General Manager - American Express Corporate Payments France Benelux), Expensya offers end-to-end automation for managing company expenses‚Äîfrom budget setting and validation to payment processing and accounting integration. With a diverse team of over 160 employees across four countries, Expensya proudly serves more than 6,000 companies worldwide, catering to over 700,000 users. Our exceptional solution combines professional payment cards and digital management software, empowering businesses to streamline their financial processes while maintaining robust control over spending through predefined budgets.

description: Every day, our customer‚Äôs providers, subsidiaries, and employees create digital instances to make their business thrive. And they are not aware of it. These instances are the best way to attack an organization. We help them detect vulnerable assets outside of corporate networks and provide intel to protect them from most critical attacks on shadow assets. Mission We are looking for a Senior Product Designer with a strong experience in UI Design and Visual design as well as UX Design, with the ability to partner with a PM, a PMM and the Engineering team on Product Discovery. Your responsibilities You will be responsible for all aspects of user experience across all our applications: customer portal, backoffice and APIs. Our apps are used daily by cybersecurity analysts from our clients all over the world. They are relying on our product to analyze thousands of potential security incidents. Design is key to help them assess the severity of a threat and save time when managing thousands of alerts every day. We are pivoting our positioning to shift from a managed-service solution to a SaaS solution with autonomous usage of our data from our customers. You‚Äôll join the Product Team : Currently 2 Product Designers and 6 Product Managers Each Product Designer will contribute to an axis of the Product Strategy  Our Design stack : Figma, Figjam, ProductBoard, Amplitude, Confluence Your Tasks Contribute to identify the opportunities As a Product Designer, your focus will be to be the voice of our users, during the whole process. You are deeply oriented around actual customers and the value their product brings to those customers. Partner with a Product Manager, a PMM and the engineering team for one of our teams, lead by a product goal.  Conduct product discovery & user research to guide product & design decisions by factual user feedback, and increase our user knowledge Collect, review, analyze and organize regularly the user feedback for a product area Lead interviews to understand personae, identify specify friction points, pains or needs to identify product opportunities Test, iterate and validate hypotheses As a Product Designer, you play a key role to increase the confidence on the product hypotheses.  Facilitate ideation workshops with cybersecurity experts, product & engineering teams Produce prototypes to explore and test hypotheses and iterate on them.  Use quantitative and qualitative techniques to increase the level of confidence in the ideas we propose building. Measure the success of the product hypotheses Design of the solution As a Product Designer, you design the best solution for our users with a strong partnership with the engineering team Define flows, information architecture and meaningful user interface Understand and apply accessibility best practices Deliver UI design with an attention to component consistency and design the edge cases Develop and maintain a comprehensive Design System to ensure design consistency across the product. Create and update UI style guides, design patterns, and component libraries to facilitate efficient design and development. Collaborate with developers during the whole product lifecycle (technical issues, anticipation, handoff, iteration)

description_entreprise: First of all: why ‚ÄúCybel‚Äù? Cybele was the keeper of knowledge in Greek mythology, and at CybelAngel we protect the knowledge of our customers. How? ‚ÄòOr‚Äô What ? By detecting data leaks on the vastness of the Internet (Deep web, Dark web, Clear web and Connected Objects). CybelAngel was founded in 2013 in Paris and we count more than 180 employees worldwide (in the US, France and the UK). We have a culture of team spirit, ambition and a high commitment to ethics. We are constantly looking to add new talents and expertise in order to help us solve the growing security threats over the Web. In order to ensure our growth, we carried out a successful Series B fund raise in Feb. 2020 with a total founding of $ 52M.  Our values: Be Curious; Be Bold and Stronger Together! CybelAngel‚Äôs mission is to create cutting-edge technologies to make the Internet a safer place. Thanks to our in-house developed solution we are able to detect data leaks over the Internet (e.g. Dark Web, Deep Web) as well as connected devices. Using artificial intelligence, we identify sensitive data and provide a real-time alert service to our clients. We are therefore able to help major companies in securing and protecting their sensitive and confidential information and anticipating high risk security threats.

description: We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Junior Product Owner Intern to join our team. description_entreprise: Streem Energy is the first data hub to help renewable energy players to manage and market their produced electricity , relying heavily on artificial intelligence and data models. Streem provides innovative SaaS solutions for the increasingly distributed power market.  Headquartered in Paris, the company was founded in 2020, and has found immediate success commercializing a first version of its platform among independent power producers in France, Belgium, Spain and Germany, as we continue towards creating a unified European data hub for renewables  Their customers are all along the electricity value chain; ranging from renewable energy producers, power aggregators, energy retailers. description: The digital experience is at the heart of the Urban Campus vision. We are convinced that design & technology are key to creating a seamless and consistent user experience, achieving our vision and successfully redefining how we live in cities. We have created a range of custom applications and services that fully digitalize the resident‚Äôs experience: from moving-in to living daily, moving-out our spaces, and supporting our operational teams in their daily activities. What you‚Äôll do: Engage with users by  answering technical queries and bug reports Prioritize, diagnose and solve  support request  yourself or with the assistance from the development team when needed. This involves  writing SQL queries ,  running scripts  and updating them. Document, track and share feedback  from your interactions with users with the rest of the team to drive the future of the product Educate our customers on the use of the platform,  by writing and updating tutorials  on our tools,  performing trainings , etc. Support the product managers in the  testing and validation of new features  before they are released to final users The  Support Engineer  will report to the Product Manager and work closely with the developers, and the Operations teams. Your journey at Urban Campus: 1st month You will learn about the product, the product vision and get to visit our spaces to better understand the full coliving experience. You will learn about our development processes and our technical stack. You will learn about our customers, the internal teams and current processes. You will take care of your first incidents and development requests supported by the Product Manager. You begin testing features with the support of the Junior Product Owner By the 3rd month You can make your first diagnosis. You know how to fix the simple requests via script or via our tools You write your first queries on our reporting tool You challenge the requests and are able to differentiate a bug from a misuse of the tool You test all features before their release to Production You have made your first contributions to the user manuals and trained new users. By the 6th month You are autonomous on the management of all support request and know how to answer to each You work with the tech team to identify and report bugs. You improve processes (ticketing, incident escalation management, crisis management). You are autonomous on writing new reports in SQL You are leading the evolution of user manuals and training materials You are a driving force behind product development and give real insights about the support to the product team You work closely with the product to define the future features of the product

description_entreprise: It is time for people-centric living and working spaces. That is what Urban Campus does. They design and operate spaces (Urban Campuses), with the aim of transforming how people live together in cities. Urban Campus offers coliving, coworking and shared spaces, that support the modern lifestyle of professionals, who value social interactions. They create communities of like-minded people and animate them by regularly organizing events and activities. Why? To answer significant societal changes. Cities are more and more attractive, people are hyperconnected yet they suffer from loneliness, they constantly are in motion and crave flexibility, freedom, and socialization. Urban Campus welcomes all curious minds. They want to offer opportunities for everyone to discover, learn, test, make‚Ä¶ a little or a lot. They support people in their personal or professional projects.

secteur_activite: Blockchain
description_entreprise: Since 2016, iExec has been building a Web3 Marketplace for computing assets. In the iExec Marketplace, users can monetize the use of their applications, data, and computing power, while keeping ownership and confidentiality of the assets being traded. iExec uses the Ethereum blockchain to organize transactions in the Marketplace, bringing governance, trust, and security.  iExec also offers consulting and support to companies in the development of blockchain projects. For example, assets tokenization, confidential data sharing, value transfer, and smart contracts. iExec has been financed through an ICO, a fundraising in cryptocurrencies that raised 10,000 Bitcoins in 3 hours. The company has also created its own cryptocurrency token, the RLC, available on all the main global exchange platforms.

intitule: 6-Month Internship ‚Äì Purchasing - January / March 2024 - L'Or√©al France
description: More precisely, you will have the chance to work within one of our wide variety of purchasing areas:   DIRECT PURCHASING Raw materials: ‚ÄØVarious raw materials are used in the composition of formulas and the manufacture of products: polymers, natural ingredients, perfumes, sun filters, vitamins‚Ä¶ L‚ÄôOr√©al sources its raw materials from specialist suppliers, committed to the constant search for quality and safety. Packaging: ‚ÄØThe purpose of packaging is to protect and enhance the product. For L‚ÄôOr√©al, it is essential that our packaging is innovative and environmentally friendly. Contract Manufacturing: ‚ÄØIn addition to its own in-house plants, the Group uses a panel of subcontracting companies for packaging or the manufacture of specific finished products (soaps, pencils, wipes‚Ä¶) and logistics services. INDIRECT PURCHASING Retail & Promotion: ‚ÄØPromotion of products is a strategic area of communication for L‚ÄôOr√©al brands. Point-of-sale advertising and promotional items are important ways of winning over consumers. They require creativity, innovation and a competitive edge from suppliers of multi-material‚ÄØPOS displays‚ÄØ(metal, plastic, wood, etc.),‚ÄØcardboard displays, boxes, printing (notices, book, etc.) and consumer gift accessories (luggage, textiles, accessories, etc.). Marketing Services: ‚ÄØSimilarly, and as a complement to Retail and Promo, the brands rely on Marketing Services aimed at making the products known and accompanying the consumer at the point of sale. These include creative agencies, post-production, advertising space, and market research, not forgetting digital media. Business Services: ‚ÄØVarious expenses are essential to the smooth running and development of the Group. These general and administrative expenses are all the costs incurred by L‚ÄôOr√©al to carry out its activities, excluding production costs. In other words, they include all expenses related to Human Resources, Consulting, IT & Telecom, Facility Management & Utilities, Travel, Events, etc. This Purchasing area handles all expenses for L‚ÄôOr√©al sites worldwide. Industrial and Devices: ‚ÄØIn order to equip and operate the production lines of its factories around the world, L‚ÄôOr√©al works on a daily basis with many industry suppliers specialized in manufacturing equipment, packaging machinery and industrial utilities. Excellence Team: ‚ÄØThe role of the Excellence Team is to define the global purchasing strategy while working on common projects to the different areas. These teams work in particular on tools but also on projects guaranteeing the conformity of purchases at the international level. description_entreprise: The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures. Beauty is a powerful force that moves us. We know that beauty is more than just looking good. Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others. For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty. We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development. Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity. Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services. Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty. Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles. And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact. Therefore: We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature. We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees. We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve. We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration. We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model. We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage. We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

description: Job Description: With the upcoming launch of ACC gigafactories in France, Germany, and Italy, we are looking to recruit project-minded specialist to join the core group of our launch team. This core team of experts will travel from one Gigafactory to another and its main mission will be to prepare and assist in the industrialization and launch of new manufacturing units. We are looking for multicultural, geographically flexible professionals who thrive on taking up challenges. In this context we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Web Handling Expert to join our team. As a Web Handling Expert, you will be responsible for developing and implementing efficient and effective web handling processes within our manufacturing facility. Your expertise in web handling and roller adjustment will be critical in ensuring the smooth and reliable operation of our electrodes coating, drying processes and calendering & slitting processes. Responsibilities: Optimize web handling processes : Develop and optimize web handling systems and processes for cell manufacturing, considering factors such as material characteristics (strainstress curve : Elongation & tensile strength), web tension and regulation, alignment, winding/unwinding, web slitting, guiding, and transport mechanisms. Understand the deformation behaviour (in case of high pressure applied or Sudden T¬∞C change). Troubleshooting and problem resolution : Investigate and diagnose web handling issues during production launching phase but also transitional start and stop phases, including misalignment, wrinkling, curling, waving and breakage. Develop and implement corrective actions to address problems and prevent their recurrence. Equipment selection and evaluation : Identify and recommend suitable web handling equipment, such as rollers, tension control systems, splicers, and web guides. Evaluate equipment performance, capabilities, and specifications to ensure compatibility with manufacturing requirements. Support commissioning of coating and drying processes and calendering & slitting processes during ramp up of manufacturing plants. Process improvement : Continuously evaluate and improve web handling processes to enhance productivity, minimize waste, reduce downtime, and optimize overall equipment effectiveness (OEE). Implement best practices and innovative techniques to achieve process excellence. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and emerging trends in manufacturing processes, and propose innovative solutions for continuous improvement. Collaboration and cross-functional support : Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, technicians, and production operators, to provide technical expertise and support. Collaborate on process improvement initiatives, equipment upgrades, and new product development projects. Training and knowledge sharing : Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate manufacturing personnel on web handling principles, techniques, and safety practices. Share your expertise and provide guidance to enhance the overall knowledge and competency of the team. Documentation and reporting : Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to web handling processes, equipment specifications, standard operating procedures (SOPs), troubleshooting guides, and process improvement initiatives. Prepare reports and present findings to management as required.

description: Occupational Summary:  Coordinates implementation processes of engineering changes that are generated in order to be implemented in a timely manner, ensuring compliance with the established customer and organization requirements in terms of safety, production, quality and cost to ensure customers satisfaction, managing human and material resources efficiently. Duties and Responsibilities:  1. Coordinate product's engineering change implementation process, coordinating with engineering planner QA, Supply Chain, Operations. 2.  Ensure rework is being processed for nonconforming product associated with engineering changes. 3.  Understand and respect the QMS interfaces with the processes in whom it interacts. 4.   Keep relevant information available as required for analysis. 5.    Participate in the continuous improvement programs established in the Organization (Example: suggestion program, lean manufacturing, 6 Sigma, AS 9100, etc.). 6.    Coordinates Changes Request (after originator does value trade analysis) with Project Engineer (Project Engineer rep), Manufacturing Engineering, Operations Program Manager, Tooling and Supply Chain. 7.  Set's serialization of Engineering Change Request based on CCB analysis of inventory levels, cost, and lead-time for planning, tooling, and sourcing.  8.   Assists in analysis for usage of parts affected and cause/effect of proposed changes.  9.   Provides process metrics to support implementation plan and to drive Continuous Improvement.  10.   Communicates Engineering Change Requests to all departments affected. This includes but not limited to: CCB containment and re-work team, Manufacturing Planning, Supply Chain, PC&L and Production. 11.    Performs other duties as assigned. 12.  Provide reporting 13.   Secure the implementation plan by organizing meetings and follow-up with stakeholders 14.   Define/validate change implementation and steer if the initial plan is no longer achievable  15.    Verify change implementation plan adherence and supports analysis after the implementation, explaining the gap to the plan. 16. Participate and lead projects & Drive Continuous Improvement 17.    Assists the Change Management Administrator / Manager by researching and gathering data related to the engineering change request. This will include the lead time and cost of tooling changes, new parts and/or rework of parts. Must have an understanding of engineering, manufacturing bill of materials (BOM), tooling, planning and supply chain. Use the Engineering and Production Schedules to set effectivity for change incorporation. Assist in the cost benefit analysis of the requested change and be able to communicate with all levels of the organization as required. 18.   Document as required and implement assigned QMS processes.

description: You will be expected to help the team deliver high quality metrics-based consulting services to our clients in France. description: The Video Network Product Management team is looking for an experienced Product Manager to support the growth of its Content Delivery solutions, part of the Direct-to-Consumer portfolio. Content Delivery solutions addresses Media and Entertainment challenges in the delivery at scale of content while ensuring high quality of service and advanced consumer experiences. This software solution is available worldwide and is leveraging the latest technologies: AI for traffic prediction, Cloud for elasticity and 5G for mobile delivery. The ideal candidate has experience with the latest software technologies, is passionate about all aspects of product management and business planning, comfortable with engaging directly with customers, can represent Synamedia‚Äôs content delivery solutions across the industry and strives to evolves the portfolio to grow the business. You will work closely together with the other Video Network product managers and solution architects in the team. The edge solution architect will be an important partner for bringing in thought leadership solutions to fight piracy, support edge processing for 5G and targeted advertising. Responsibilities Manage the product process from concept to launch to ongoing maintenance, including gathering and defining product requirements, setting priorities, overseeing development planning and product releases, and guiding ongoing product support and maintenance. Help define a comprehensive product roadmap and ensure the product meets customer and market needs and is delivered on time. Coordinate product development activity with R&D, continuously prioritising features and schedules to match defined market and customer needs and ensuring alignment on requirements and delivery. Perform market analysis, cost & pricing analysis, and product forecasting Collaborate with field sales, marketing organizations and Synamedia partners to ensure effective alignment around market focus and strategy. Provide a channel for bi-directional feedback, and ensure the overall success and growth of the edge product portfolio Support sales and marketing efforts as required. Travel on a regular base will be required

description: I nternship Overview As a Customer Success Business Analyst Intern, you will be an integral part of our Customer Success team, where you‚Äôll gain hands-on experience in data analysis, business analytics, and customer relationship management within a SaaS environment. You will work closely with our team to drive data-driven decision-making and improve customer health scores. Main Activities During your internship, you will be involved in the following key activities: Data-Driven Health Scoring:  Conduct research to develop and enhance data-driven health scoring for SaaS companies, enabling us to better understand and improve customer health. Data-Driven Decision Making:  Assist in building processes that leverage data to make informed decisions about our subscribed customers‚Äô health and success. Grafana Dashboards:  Create and maintain dashboards using Grafana, which will help us answer questions about customer usage, value, and quality. Identify areas for improvement and potential obstacles. Customer Data and Knowledge Management:  Play a vital role in managing customer data and knowledge, ensuring we have a comprehensive understanding of our customer base. Customer Health Score Playbook:  Collaborate on building a playbook focused on customer health scoring, which will guide our approach to assessing and enhancing customer success. What You Will Work On   Your daily activities will be divided into approximately 70% data analytics and 30% operational improvements. Here are some specific tasks you‚Äôll be involved in: Data Analysis:  Compile and analyze data to help optimize our clients‚Äô outcomes and identify areas for improvement. Customer Trend Analysis:  Conduct in-depth reviews of customer trends to uncover opportunities for enhancing the customer experience and operational processes. Data Evaluation:  Research and evaluate data from various sources to identify patterns, trends, and discrepancies. Data Storytelling:  Convert data into meaningful insights that can be easily understood by clients, and effectively communicate the story behind the data. Communication:  Present your findings and analytic insights to management, contributing to data-informed decision-making. Client Performance Enhancement:  Suggest actionable strategies to enhance client performance based on your data analysis.

description: Context:  We are currently seeking a talented and motivated Bioinformatician to join our team for an exciting project funded by the European  Horizon Europe 2022. Background:  Ciliopathies, a group of rare genetic diseases, result from primary cilium dysfunction and manifest in various severe disorders. TheRaCil project aims to enhance the diagnosis and prognosis of pediatric renal ciliopathy patients while implementing therapeutic approaches. The project involves a consortium of European partners leveraging unique databases and multi-omics data for patient stratification and identification of therapeutic targets. Mission Objectives:  The recruited professional will play a crucial role in two key aspects of TheRaCil project: Genetic Modifiers of Renal Disease Onset: Replicate and expand upon WGS project on genetic modifiers of age at onset of ESKD; Utilize genomics data within the consortium for further GWAS analyses, identifying new modifiers ; Study the functional impact of genetic modifiers through RNAseq experiments. Molecular Signatures of Therapeutic Interventions: Analyze scRNASeq and snRNASeq data from human cellular and mouse models to understand the impact of therapeutic interventions on molecular signatures ; Identify primary target cell populations, evaluate single-cell responses, and assess immune cell occurrence.

description: Zeliq is created early 2023 by Dorian (CEO, ex. Hivency co-founder), Victor (CTO, ex. Pumpkin co-founder) and Guillaume (COO). Identify and prioritize growth opportunities across multiple channels including email, social media, paid advertising, content marketing, and SEO. description: 1.   Occupational Summary (Position Objective & Authorities) Objective: Under the responsibility of the VP Supply Chain, the S&OP Manager is responsible to establish realistic short, medium and long-term customer supply programs, based on the sales projections provided and validated by the Program and Sales departments. The S&OP Manager is responsible to coordinate all aspects of the S&OP process : ‚Ä¢  by assisting or conducting all necessary preparatory reviews such as Product, Demand, Internal & External Supply and RTDI reviews ‚Ä¢ by submitting during Business review, a set of scenario to General Management supporting customer needs while balancing the best usage of company means (Manufacturing & Engineering & Financial) SOP Manager is also responsible for driving S&OP process improvement in line with One Safran Standards. Authorities: This position has the authority and the right to control, command Sales and Operations Planning activities and ensure compliance to the applicable defined company Supply Chain policies, processes, practices and the defined objectives. 1.  Essential Functions (Duties and Responsibilities) A.    Coordinate all aspects of the Sales and Operations Plan (S&OP) process. o   Analyze and incorporate the variations in demand into the supply plan in preparation for the supply point capability review. Demand includes the full coverage of SEATS activity as OEM programs (Passengers, Cockpit & Crew from Marketing, Development & Serial), Aftermarket Spare parts & Repairs o Carry out scenario modelling for the various demand hypothesis (high, nominal, low) o   Ensure that the Supply and Demand is coherent with the orientations of the strategic plan and in cases of significant deviation provide an alert during the Supply Point Capability Review o    Review and assess the demonstrated performance and latest capabilities  o   Validate the assumptions, rates and industrial patterns and establish the monthly manufacturing Production Plan o   Perform the Resource Planning to test the feasibility of the Production plan against critical resources o   Identify the load/capacity imbalances (internal & external) on the mid-term plan, develop scenarios and make recommendations to resolve in order to establish the appropriate action plan  o    Analyze the hazards and uncertainties impacting resources (internal & external) and customer demand o   Implement action plans to reduce hazards, (i.e. uncertainties, new developments, transfers) in order to maintain the desired service level within their scope of activities.  o Work with the finance sector to provide a financial assessment of the plan o    Update the data in the different information systems within the scope of their activities especially the definition of the macro data used in S & OP implementation and update KPIs in areas of activity.

description: Manutan, a French family-run group and a major European B2B player, has been a partner to enterprises, local authorities, and traders for nearly 60 years, specializing in the distribution of equipment and supplies.  Its hybrid model, combining the strengths of digital (e-commerce platforms) with a human-centric approach (sales forces), enables Manutan to guide its clients towards more sustainable and ethical performance along with the implementation of a purchasing optimisation strategy.  With 27 subsidiaries in 17 European countries, the Group has over 2,200 employees and achieved a turnover of 946 million euros in 2022/23. Manutan France is awarded Best Workplaces 2023 and 12 other subsidiaries among the Group are certified Great Place to Work. Responsibilities and missions Grow the Design team and take the Design vision to a strategic level.  As Head of Design within the e-Commerce/Cx Department you will be responsible for managing and mentoring a team of UX/UI product designers. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the design strategy, ensuring the delivery of user-centric and visually compelling solutions, and driving our commitment to excellence in customer experience. Main Responsibilities:   Team Leadership : Motivate and coach the team, stimulate creativity, develop skills, define career paths...  Grow:  Attract and recruit talented Designers (/ User researchers / UX writers...). Design Strategy : Define the design team's objectives and priorities. Develop and execute a clear design strategy aligned with business objectives.  Stakeholder Collaboration : organize the design team to ensure effective communication and collaboration (with tech and Product) throughout the product development lifecycle. Work closely with feature teams to align design efforts with the overall product vision and user needs. Collaborate with the CMI team to integrate customer feedback & market trends into the design process. Design Standards : Establish and maintain design standards, guidelines, and best practices to ensure a cohesive and best in class user experience across our products.  Design rituals : Create and implement design team processes and rituals.  Make it shiny : promote the Design team externally to raise Manutan's profile and attract new talent.

description: Key Responsibilities:   Lead and own the ideation and deployment of innovative AI-driven products.   Foster collaborative development across teams, balancing independent solution design with team-based approaches.   Cultivate a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing, focusing on emerging technologies and methodologies.   Drive product vision and strategy, clearly communicating objectives to internal and external stakeholders.   Define ambitious product roadmaps, navigating through ambiguous and uncharted product areas.   Synthesize market needs, user stories, and client requirements into actionable product strategies.   Utilize data analysis to inform product success, feature development, and overall health.   Maintain a deep understanding of the AI landscape to ensure competitive product positioning.   Build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues, clients, and industry partners.   Navigate and execute product strategies amidst ambiguity, adapting to various domains based on business needs.

description_entreprise: Descartes & Mauss is a StraTech, an AI-powered platform for strategy-making. Founded in 2021, D&M models the future to build critical paths for companies to find growth and resilience. By combining advanced data modelling capabilities with a creative methodology rooted in social sciences, D&M de-risks decision-making and gives leaders back their capacity to act.

intitule: Capital Markets internship - Bigdata & Analytics Fintech
description: What are you going to do?  You will join the Market team and report to the Head of Customer Experience. You will need to be technically literate with an interest for business, the ideal profile being an student engineer that wants to expose himself to how business works. During the internship you will discover how Opensee converts prospective sales opportunities into fully fledged clients. This will entail for instance: Business development material to help highlight the capabilities of the Opensee solution The scripting of rock-solid demos of our solution, customized according to the needs and use cases of prospective clients As prospective clients progress through the sales lifecycle, helping and supporting them with Proof Of Concepts (POC) deployed on their environment for several weeks and ensure that those POCs are a success and lead to additional sales By mastering our UI inside-out, participate in its improvement through suggestions to the dev team and testing of the enhancements the team works on. Equally, you will be able to run our solution directly from an API software (e-g Insomnia, PostMan) or through Opensee‚Äôs Python library. By understanding the data models / architecture of demos environments and POCs, help optimise them constantly As part of the wider Product Management team, managing some aspects of the product enhancements for the development team, for instance: specifications, technical design, prioritization, progress tracking, testing and documentation  You will in particular develop the following technical skills: IT: Big Data technologies, SQL, Python, Software management Finance: Front office tools and Risk Management calculations Project Management: demo preparation, POC preparation and monitoring, management of development projects with dev teams, and management of implementation projects with client teams
secteur_activite: IT / Digital, FinTech / InsurTech, Big Data
description_entreprise: In 2018, Opensee decided to tackle one of the hardest challenges of financial institutions : make simple, interactive and quick data-driven decisions leveraging their massive amounts of data and financial industry expertise. To deliver a no-compromise solution enabling to exploit huge volumes with speed and high performance at a lower cost than existing benchmarks, Opensee chose to break the status quo: Tear down down silos and challenge existing development processes Co-build a strong partnership with their clients to find together the smartest and most efficient solution. Today this fast-growing international Fintech offers a high performance solution to the major financial institutions in Paris, London and New-York, helping them overcome new risk management challenges by handling and exploiting their massive datasets.
